Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: KarenECS
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a beautiful city for walking and from Hotel Constanza you can walk to all the major sites easily. The room was clean, the bed comfy and the decor modern. The walls seemed a bit thin--we could hear water from the room above us but the hotel guests were so quiet (it seemed like a fair number of business travelers) that that is all we heard. We were on the street side and our room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights wasn't enough”
Reviews.Author: DanLia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 night with my fiancé (9.5/10) Had a brilliant time but needed more than 2 days to explore the place. The hotel was clean and the location was great. We went down for breakfast first morning and were waiting to be served by one waiter rushed off his feet. We then found out after a mediocre breakfast that this was chargeable on top of our room rate, needless to say I complained and was not charged. Free Internet in reception lobby area, helpful receptionist and modern looking interior decor. Worth another visit

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice deco but breakfast disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dmoraleslourido
Reviews.Content: I liked Hotel Constanza and thought the location was great. It's very near all the major sights and in a superb area. After a day walking around Barcelona full of people it's nice to go back to a place that is quite and that looks good. My only complaint is breakfast for which I paid the package for the 3 days of my stay. The standard was somehow poor, not great variety and the food wasn't all ready when it was supposed to be. If you were one of the first ones in the restaurant you had to ask the waiter to asked for the food to be taken out of the kitchen or actually cooked (it was a buffet) and that was if you knew there were more attractive options. Not all the food was fresh so the standard wasn't uniform during all my stay, on the first day I had stale bread and the tortilla didn't seem that fresh. The staff is helpful and try to address your concerns and help you finding local information. Hopefully they can work on the food issue as I would love to go back there in my next visit. I'm rating the swimming pool and fitness centre as it doesn't let me submit my review otherwise but it's N/A

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: travellingwests
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Constanza and it was a great trip. The hotel staff was friendly and check in was quick and easy. The location is the best feature of this hotel. My husband and I were able to walk to most of the things that we wanted to see. Las Ramblas is about a 10 minute walk. You can also get to the Picasso Museum, Gothic Area and more. We loved Barcelona because the people were friendly and many spoke English. The hotel staff also spoke English. I would have given the hotel a perfect rating but the construction next door is ongoing and it will be going on for awhile. The noise started around 8am but it was not a problem for us because we are early risers. There are many restaurants and cafes nearby. We did not do the hotel breakfast. We did not enjoy our meal at Tapas 24 or Tapa Tapas, but we found many places that were excellent but you have to look at prices and menus before you go inside. There is also an excellent Irish pub nearby. I believe it was called George Payne. Prices and food were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “New stylish decor, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gkgl81
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at Constanza. Lovely rooms, and we had a balcony looking out on to the street. Staff had good recommendations of places for tapas. One negative point is that you could hear noises from other rooms, for example when other people are showering you could feel the vibrations of the water going through pipes. Location is quite good, not bang in the middle of the old town but it's a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great week”
Reviews.Author: MJK54_11
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The staff are incredibly helpful, it is easy walking distance to the centre of the old city and less than 10 minutes walk to Catalunya Square. The rooms are great.It is really quiet. We stayed 6 nights and with a special deal from Booking.com it made it a great buy. The only downside is that there is a lack of good food places handy but a 15 minute walk to the waterfront area solves that. Best pick Sensi restaurant. Amazing meal but book - it is incredibly popular.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Fable1301
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Constanza for the Grand Prix and were able to enjoy not only the event but also Barcelona from this wonderful location. The rooms themselves are absolutely beautiful with marvellous facilities including brilliant waterfall showers! The terrace balcony was very small, but just this little space and the option to open the windows were very welcome. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful and the breakfast choices were amazing!! Would definitely stay here again without hesitation and would recommend to anyone travelling to Barcelona without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff Would recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: damof89
Reviews.Content: Was really happy with this hotel. Staff were excellent, great english speaking and very helpfull. Its in a great location, walking distance to everything,only used a taxi once over the four days we were there. Room was very clean and modern with a balcony and also a fridge which is handy. It also has a rooftop terrace,but couldnt access,must only open in summer time.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: seaski42
Reviews.Content: Returning to the Hotel Constanza after a busy day of touring Barcelona was a calming relief. It was close to all of the attractions but seemed set apart from the frantic pace of the city. The lobby was very zen, the rooms clean and refreshing and the staff accommodating. It is a little expensive but we felt it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DCSC001
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is well located, very clean, simple decorations and yet a large room We appreciated the simplicity, great balcony, and good location - side street, yet close to shopping and transportation. A very good bar/restaurant is attached, and many other choices within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Not so Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Yogmart
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend break. The Hotel is in a fantastic Location. We flew into Barcelona Airport and out from Girona and the Constanza was a great location to get to and from both Airports by Bus. The Hotel is not far from Las Ramblas and the Square at Placa De Catalunya. It is very central and within walking distance of the major sights. It was very well decorated and very clean. The staff were very friendly and it was generally a nice hotel. The only problem I had was the room. It was on the 1st floor looking at a wall and was very dark - all day. That, however, was not the biggest problem with the room. The noise was far worse as when people were walking around next door or upstairs it sounded as though they were in our room and if someone flushed a toilet in another room you could hear it really loudly. Its for this reason alone that I only gave 3 Stars. It was not a cheap Hotel and I dont think a bit of soundproof is too much to ask for. I would stay here again and recommend this Hotel if I didnt have the noisy dark Room.

Reviews.Title: “Just out of the centre but still close enough to the sights.”
Reviews.Author: golem11
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers reasonable value in a location that is away from the busiest areas of the city but still within a comfortable distance to many of the major sights. The décor is modern with pale walls and dark brown wood effect furniture. Our room (308) wasn’t particularly large but was sufficient for our needs. It had a flat screen TV, comfortable bed, room safe, mini bar, balcony with chairs and a table (even if the view was somewhat lacking) and the usual storage options you’d expect. The bathroom was also modern in design with a large shower and thee room was well maintained and spotlessly clean throughout. All in all the accommodation itself was very good. The staff on reception were friendly and helpful and there’s free internet access available in the comfortable lobby area if you haven’t taken your own laptop/tablet with you and need to get online. There were only a few small niggles none of which were substantial. Our room safe didn’t lock initially but this was quickly sorted out by a member of staff. The mini bar in our room didn’t actually keep anything cold although we don’t use hotel mini bars anyway so this wasn’t an issue but we reported it to reception on departure who were going to check it out. The BBC channel didn't work on TV but the free internet access meant we could check online if we really wanted to. The roof terrace bar wasn’t open which was a pity as it was warm while we were staying and we would have liked to have utilised this facility. The building work which other reviewers have mentioned is continuing on the property next door. We stayed from Friday to Monday and while there was no building work at the weekend it started at around 7am on Monday morning. It wasn’t a big deal for us as we are early risers but it was loud enough to wake us and could be an issue for guests staying during the week. Ultimately this is beyond the control of the hotel though. As far as location goes it’s only three blocks from the nearest metro station. If you arrive by train from the airport (cheaper than a bus and much cheaper than a taxi) you use the same station but a different exit which is a further three blocks away on Passeig de Grazia. Even so it takes less than ten minutes to walk to the hotel with your luggage and it’s not difficult. It takes about twenty minutes to walk to Sagrada Familia, about the same to the marina and sea front, about fifteen minutes to Casa Mila and about ten minutes to La Rambla. It’s best to take the metro if you want to visit Park Guell or the Magic Fountains. The metro is quick and inexpensive and if you plan on using it regularly it’s cheaper to use one of the multi-trip tickets such as the T-10 which works out at under €1 per journey. If you plan on visiting the Magic Fountains one evening be aware that they only operate on certain evenings which vary depending on the time of year. The Gaudi sights do get extremely busy so if you can get to them early you’ll save yourself having to fight through the crowds. There is a supermarket a couple of streets away from the hotel if you need to pick up any bits and pieces. There is a tapas restaurant attached to the hotel (closed on Sunday) but having eaten there on our first night we weren’t that impressed. There are a couple of other bars and restaurants in the same street but Barcelona has no shortage of eateries so you don’t need to go far to expand your options. On the whole though I’d recommend the Hotel Constanza and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: disdonc
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here! It was quiet and clean. The service was good. The showers were great. Breakfast was very good. The location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Constanza March 2012”
Reviews.Author: Colomalady
Reviews.Content: We had a superb stay at this hotel. The room was spacious with a good sized balcony. Very roomy bathroom with great shower. The room was spotless and cleaned every day. The hotel was very central. Just a few streets away from Plaza Catalunya & La Rambla. Within walking distance of the sea. Although central the hotel was very quiet and peaceful. The perfect place to relax after a days sightseeing. The staff were friendly and helpful. Spoke very good English and all in all our time in Barcelona was truly enjoyable. A&F Croydon

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not more, not less.”
Reviews.Author: Elien C
Reviews.Content: It was a normal hotel, and very friendly and helpfull staff. With a great breakfast ( and cheap > 10 euro's ). And free fast/normal internet. Bathroom was a little bit to cramped and muggy. And the rooms adjacent to our rooms where verry loud. We could hear the television of the room next to ours, the entire night. But overall price/quality great.

Reviews.Title: “"Centrally located, rooms are exceptionally clean, staff is very helpful!"”
Reviews.Author: RossieWilliams
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very helpful to us! With their professional assistance we had a very enjoyable experience in Barcelona. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. We would highly recommend this affordable place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bangcocky
Reviews.Content: Booked a weekend in Barcelona for my husband and I and we wanted to stay which was in easy walking distance of all the attractions/sites, but was also away from the tourist area, eg, La Ramblas. We chose Hotel Constanza in L'Eixample and we were not disappointed! Area is perfect as it not only has it's own great bars, restaurants and cafes, but is also in walking distance of other parts of Barcelona. We walked everywhere from our hotel! Although it was very quiet during our stay and the roof top terrace was not open due to it being out of season, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed on the 4th floor in a double room which was clean, spacious and had a huge TV and a huge shower. Hotel has a bar/restaurant next door which also serves breakfast and is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Didyeah
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for a 3 day visiting and we wanted to have a nice place to stay and this is definitively one to recommend. The hotel is modern, convenient, really decorated with class, and you have the impression to be in a much higher standard place than it is supposed to be. The money/quality ratio is very positive. Our room had a bath (but not all have) and the bathroom was very pleasant, clean and spacey. The location is interesting too, not in the middle of the crowdy and noisy tourist places. The hotel is, it's true, not well insonorised, but nothing dramatic. And the street is rather calm so no need to ask for a room on the yard. No many places around to eat contrary to what some said in comments (except if walking 10 min to find one is what you call around). We did not take the breakfast in, due to some saying it was not worthing the price, so we can't tell. On the bad side, the absence of anything in the bedroom to have some boiled water for tea or coffee. Forgot to say the staff is really pleasant, friendly and helpful. I don't know other hotels in Barcelona so difficult to compare but one of the best hotels I've been during my past travels in various big European cities.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: traceykennett
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back in England after a fantastic trip to Barcelona. This hotel is brilliant, it is modern, clean and our room had a great balcony to chill out on after a busy day walking around. It is far enough away from the ramblas to be away from the hustle and bustle but with a 5 minute walk you are right in the centre of everything. Everything about this hotel is amazing I I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and a very nice location”
Reviews.Author: kensog12312312312
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. Clean and modern. We stayed for 8 days. Its with in walking distance of everything the city has to offer but still away from all the noise. The staff was awesome and very friendly. Gave us a lot of pointers on places to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service & amenities”
Reviews.Author: jkriggs
Reviews.Content: By far, the best hotels I've stayed at in Spain have been in Catalonia and this is no exception. The staff were warm & friendly. The room was impeccably clean and super cute--modern without being overly pretentious, like W hotels, etc. Bed was great. And there was a fantastic terrace that'd be perfect for breakfast in the morning and cava at night (was a little too cold when we were there.) And it costed us about 50euros a night, booked only about two weeks in advance. Located centrally without being in too touristy an area. A definite recommendation--I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “high quality, good location, nice price”
Reviews.Author: donstefano
Reviews.Content: I paid just 52,50 eur for a single roon/night, and what I got for this exceeded my expectations considerably. The rooms reminded me of the always well-furnished and decorated rooms you normally get at NH hotels - so modern chic. My room was spacious, had its own balcony, and everything was brand new. Heating worked fine during these cold February days. Soundproofing towards the street worked well. Everything is in walking distance, and there's a metro station nearby. Check-in was very efficient - the friendly staff had prepared everything in advance. Housekeeping also did a very good job. I did not take breakfast there - you can find plenty of cafes nearby to have your cafe con leche. Only tiny negative point is that apparently someone messed up the Tv channels making it hard for me to find the few non-Spanish ones. This is a place I will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bmlwtrip
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern room. Friendly staff. Ask for a room in the back (with a balcony).

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: esavva
Reviews.Content: The hotel Constanza was situated in a very convenient location in walking-distance to La Rambla and Placa Catalunya. It was spotlessly clean, the staff were very helpful and it was warm at all times. The room was a little on the small size but very comfortable with constant hot water and always quiet! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pay extra for a double room.”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugVietnam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Constanza twice in a month. The first visit I was traveling solo so booked a single room and was given room 112. This was my first visit to Spain but I was surprised at how small the room was. It was furnished in chocolate brown and with only one light near the door, made it very dark. There was a lamp by the bed, but it was impossible to read at night. The wash basin was the tiniest I have ever seen, which meant I had to kneel on the floor and do my laundry in the bath. When I discussed this with the reception staff, they said they had given me the best single room in the hotel and offered to show me the others, which I declined. I liked the very convenient location of the hotel and I told them I would be returning to Barcelona with a friend in 3 weeks time and could they give me a twin room at a good rate. This they did and we were given room 306, which was large and had a separate area with a sofa and wardrobe between the bedroom and the bathroom. This was a great area to put our bags. The bathroom was spacious and had a large shower recess and basin. We were extremely happy in this room for the last 4 nights of our stay in Spain. The free computer use in the lobby was much appreciated and the reception staff were always happy to help us with directions etc. It was walking distance to the main upmarket shopping street, more restaurants than you could try in a lifetime, the airport bus, and most of the popular sites. A special thank you to Radha in reception for his friendliness and professionalism. When I return to Barcelona I would happily stay here again but I would pay extra and get the larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: xena82
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Constanza for 2 nights in December with my family. We took the short train ride from the airport to Passeig de Gracia and it was about a 15 minute walk from there. We were greeted by friendly hotel staff on arrival who were very helpful. We were able to check-in straight away even though we were quite early. We had suite rooms as they were the only ones available at the time of booking and they were great value for money. Our rooms were on the 2nd floor. They were very modern and spacious, the beds were comfy and the bathrooms were big with a massive walk-in shower. There was a TV, safe, air-con and hairdryer in the room. Our room had a small terrace which faced the external courtyard (which would have been lovely if it had been warmer!). My parents room had a lovely balcony opening out to the main road. It wasn't noisy though. The location of the hotel is great. There are lots of beautiful attractions within walking distance including the Casa Batllo and the Arc de Triomf. The start of Las Ramblas is about a 10-15 minute walk away and there's lots of small cafes and restaurants close by. There is a metro stop very close to take you further afield. Breakfast was not included with our room. However, it is available at 20 euros per person. We chose to eat there on the morning of our departure to save time. I wouldn't recommend it. It was far too expensive for what you got - bread, ham, cheese and cereal. There are much better cafes close by which we went to the day before. FYI we ended up having to get a taxi to the airport on the way back. The hotel staff booked on for us and it arrived within literally seconds. Took about 25mins and cost about 35 euros. Overall I would stay in Hotel Constanza again. Great location, nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly staff, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: WaywardTravelor
Reviews.Content: We moved to Constanza from a supposed four star hotel. Constanza beat the other hotel in every category! The desk staff was extremely helpful helping us locate another party we were traveling with. The rooms were very clean and modern. The lobby was very spacious and clean. Free computer use in the lobby and wireless in the hotel. The staff explained that they were rated two stars because they do not offer room service. Huh? This hotel is better than any for the price and value in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Kennth H
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Barcelona at a very affordable rate. The hotel staff were very helpful. The location of this hotel is excellent. I fully recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Richard V
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a quiet area just a few minutes walk from Pl Catalunya and La Rambla. Friendly, English speaking staff and a good breakfast at a reasonable price. decent sized room which was clean and well furnished. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth190724
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Constanza for 6 nights 12th - 18th January. We found this hotel catered for all our needs,the staff were all friendly and helpful the free use of the internet was also good on the computers in the public areas. We found the breakfast more than adequate and set us up for the day we also ate at Bruc33 tapas next to the hotel, the food was good and reasonably priced. The hotel was situated on a side street which was quieter than alot of areas in Barcelona, also it was close enough to Plaza Catalunya for the aerobus and the hop on off tour and La Rambla and other sights were within walking distance, if ever in Barcelona again we would not hesitate to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: aneves
Reviews.Content: Good location, new furniture, spacious rooms, a little too dark in the bathroom. Very good price for value, friendly staff. I have already stayed there twice, and I would stay in again. Highly recomendable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: martinavisaggio
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic stay at the Hotel Constanza in just about every way. The room was wonderful, very spacious, clean and modern. Upon arriving to the hotel I had had an early flight so I had to wait a while before I could check in (which was not a problem). The staff happily took my luggage and provided me with a map to do some discovering, and also suggested that I could simply hang around in the hotel and use the free wifi if I wished. I soon learnt that the hotel was situated in a ideal location! Approx. 10-15 walk to the main plaza where you could find shopping, many tourist activities and a central street in Barcelona "La Rambla". While I was waiting for my room I also discovered the amazing restaurant next door to the hotel "Bruc 33 Tapas" (also where breakfast is served). My partner, family and I loved this restaurant! The tapas was beautiful and often found ourselves eating their during our stay. Finally, the staff were excellent. Would always greet you, were happy to help with any request and provided excellent advice. As I stayed over new years eve, the staff were happy to help with dinner reservations, transport and many other tourist activities they kindly helped organise. I would certainly recommend this hotel, and would happily stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very very good!”
Reviews.Author: LMZeric
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Constanza between Christmas and new year and loved it. Very modern yet cosy, top central location and very good rates. Only one small critic: no bathrobe provided... A special mention for Rhedda at the reception who could'nt be more helpful in every way. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: CoandChan
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and were very happy to find that it is IDEALLY located. We also found the restaurant Bruc33 to be very good for lunch or dinner. Breakfast was ok, small selection but only 10 Euros. We can not say enough about the staff. We were there five nights and came to know all of them. They were very helpful with recommendations, booking a visit to Dali's house, and anything that we needed. We are so glad we found this hotel and will definitely go back. Also, the rooms were very nice and a great value. They were spotless!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caleb R
Reviews.Content: Visited Barcelona from the USA with a couple of friends for the first time... Hotel Constanza was a perfect base to see the city. It's conveniently located close to Plaza Catalunya, La Rambla, the Gothic district, great restaurants, and a number of famous sites (La Sagrida Familia, Gaudi house)... We walked everywhere. The hotel is clean and elegant, and better than advertised. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. It is a little off the beaten path, which we loved. After a busy day on La Rambla or in the Gothic district, its nice to escape down a quiet street to a hotel that's tucked away. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: Good, central location...competitive prices...clean, nice room...friendly, helpful staff. Free Wifi in lobby only.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- good location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: lil_amy_uk
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. About 10 minutes away from Las Ramblas. Some great cafes around that area on the way to Las Ramblas. Took us a while to find the hotel but once you have a map and a good navigator you will be fine! Really recommend the hotel however the breakfast at 11 euros is a bit much. Would recommend a cafe nearby as it is much cheaper. Rooms are big, bathrooms are lovely and modern. Loved the the little balcony. Staff very friendly. For the price I couldn't have asked for anything more! Will recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: IceMilo
Reviews.Content: Only about 10-15 minutes walk from La Rambla. Very convenient and good value. Rooms are a bit small but good enough for a day's rest. I will stay again on my next visit. The hotel staff at reception is also helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. It's more than 2 stars!!!”
Reviews.Author: 12Chiara
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. New and clean. The rooms are clean and silent and the beds are comfortable.The hotel is near to the metro station of Urquinaona. The staff are very kind. Why it is a 2 stars??? It's more than 2 stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms and service, moderate pricing, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bsl4500
Reviews.Content: The title kind of sums it up, yet here are a few practical notes: the floors in hotel rooms are tile so, if just like me, you´re visiting in a cooler season (December, for instance) - I´d suggest packing in slippers. I did not so I had to use my extra thick woolen socks to walk in the room (coming from a culture where walking in outdoor shoes indoors in looked down upon - and streets are not too clean either). Location: forget about taxi from/to the airport, the hotel is within a walking distance to Airbus. Staff: got excellent recommendations from a lady concierge on both sights and places to eat, no misses - glad that I asked.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff , Great location - just a top value totel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: AndyLondon186338
Reviews.Content: Staff excellent , location great for centre and very cool property - totally recommend for all types of stays !!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: Carlos B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location surrounded by subway stations making it easy to with eating options within walking distance, yet also quiet. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean. The hotel also offered free internet and use of the computers. The rainfall shower was amazing and the hotel was a great value overall. I would stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: Katehunterbadger
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff could not have been more pleasant or more helpful. They were terrific. The breakfast we passed on. Very unimaginative. Better to have great coffee & croissant elsewhere. The hotel was in a great location and of great value. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good...but not great”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in a suite at Hotel Constanza for a couple of (seperate) nights. The rooms were large and clean, if a little dark (the minimalist decor can best be described as "brown"). The sofa was uninspiringly placed near the bathroom with the only view, other than the bathroom door, being the wardrobe (you couldn't see the telly from the sofa). We didn't have a bath, only a shower. But the shower was great! The bed in the suite was actually two single beds. I knew this when I booked but I had expected them to be made into a large double - instead they were left, and made, as two seperate beds pushed together. Kind of killed the romance. On the second night that we stayed, we asked if we could change to a double room (with a double bed). They said this would be ok but that we'd still be charged the full cost of a suite. When we asked why the beds couldn't be made into a double they told us that it was because the suites were usually taken by groups of three, who used the sofa as a third bed. Huh? We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, as we found a good value cafe a couple of streets away. The hotel's bar/cafe, called 'Bruc 33', did reasonably good tapas at reasonable prices. Around the corner is the restaurant "Casa Calvet", set in a building designed by Gaudi, which I heartily recommend for a fantastic meal in a memorable setting. The hotel staff were, on the whole, polite and professional although they did ignore my request on the booking form to be given a suite at the back of the hotel (which I had read were supposed to be the best). In a nutshell, the hotel is fine and offers reasonable value. But if you're a couple and are considering splashing out on a suite, I'd recommend that you plump for a double instead.

Reviews.Title: “just great”
Reviews.Author: Tito515
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, very helpful, clean and spacious rooms and a good location too. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A real value”
Reviews.Author: lucyA123
Reviews.Content: A gem at Target prices. Location was perfect. Within walking distance to all sights. In a lovely neighborhood, not on a busy street. Would stay there again. Staff was friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: Abtrived
Reviews.Content: 5 min walk to rambla, polite and helpful staff and great rooms and facilities. no wireless internet in rooms - bring your laptops, construction nearby which is a slight nuisance. overall, pick this place and you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Great Location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MVG_11
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous, modern, comfortable room with a large, modern bathroom. Amazing service and multi-lingual front desk. We arrived early in the day and left a bag in the secure bag room, and bought discount tickets for the bus tour around Barcelona, and we signed on for the two-day tour at the bus kiosk in the main square. There was construction next door but we were not disturbed in the morning. Las Ramblas and Barri Gotic were about 4 blocks or 10 minutes walking and there are bars and cafes in the area as well. We bought beverages at a corner convenience store and took them back to the hotel and enjoyed them in the roof garden along with the wonderful view of the city at night. Being away from the main avenues it is very quiet at night and I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona in October”
Reviews.Author: Raymond P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked into the hotel after reading some great reviews. We stayed for 2 nights in mid October and neither of us were let down by any of the amenities the hotel has to offer. The location is perfect and mostly everything is within walking distance. The staff are very polite and helpful and the continental breakfast each morning is well worth getting up for. We were slightly disappointed the rooftop terrace was not opened during our stay but that didnt dampen the time went spent in Barcelona. The hotel is modern with chic decor and comfortable rooms, only a few english channels on the tele but this isnt the place you would go and sit in the rooms watching television. In all I would utterly recommend a stay in this fab hotel which will not put a big dent in your wallet by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: tarsus1
Reviews.Content: After spending a few days relaxing in the mountains of Spain we were ready for the big city. Thankfully we stayed at this amazing hotel, which provided everything we needed with ease. The hotel is clean, efficient, and located within walking distance of all the major tourist sites (The Ramblas, all of Gaudi's works including Familia, the Picasso museum, etc.). It is also on a side street, which makes it less part of the normal tourists traps / local traffic, quieter, yet within a block of everything you'd need. A supermarket is also right around the corner if you need to stock up on anything. The Front Desk help is far and beyond the most helpful of any hotel I've stayed at. Things were on time, good advise was given, friendly service provided, and our cab was waiting on us upon request. We can't recommend this hotel enough. If you're looking for something that is clean, well priced, and with an excellent location and staff, definitely stay at the Hotel Constanza.

Reviews.Title: “A good address in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: joebecquets
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Hotel Constanza in Barcelona at the end of September '11. The hotel is conveniently located near Passeig de la Gracia and Plaza Catalunya in the heart of the city. The lobby is modern and has probably been renovated recently. The staff at the front desk proved to be helpful and professional. Although we are not speaking all these languages, we have been witnesses of travelers being served in Spanish, English, French and German (in one instance, by the same employee!). Our room was located on one end of the first floor and we were blessed to have a small terrasse adjacent to our room. Make sure you ask for one of these rooms since it adds to the pleasure of staying at this hotel. The room is well furnished and a small salon adjacent to the room adds nicely to the living space. We found the sound-proofing to be somewhat deficient, even if during our stay this didn't prove to be an annoyance. The breakfast buffet served in the adjacent restaurant is ok, although I would recommend for you to find a more interesting breakfast alternative nearby. Our stay at the hotel was during the week-end. Consequently, we weren't disturbed by what looks like a major construction site next to the hotel. It would be prudent to inquire before hand about the status of this major renovation project near the hotel. One bad note for the Wifi available only in the lobby of the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Martin M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the constanza for three nights in October 2011. Impecable room for a decent price. Personnel were extremely friendly, very nice rooms even had my own balcony, and great location walking distance from everything I wanted to see. It is located at a very quiet street that allows to have a great night sleep Would stay there every time

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: catalina l
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome!! modern and comfortable rooms. We walked a lot during our vacations and so we appreciated being close to the main sights. We had a great stay, I will definitely be back! Catalina

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Paz C
Reviews.Content: I had a couple of hotels in mind and after reading the good reviews we ended up staying here. I’m glad we did! It’s a beautiful hotel. We stayed for three nights before taking the cruise and then returned for another night before leaving to Madrid. The rooms were super clean and the reception staff very friendly…and spoke English, which made things much easier. As far as construction noise, we were told that the heavy work had been done already and it seemed to be true because we didn’t hear any noise. Erin

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Alice W
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights while traveling around Spain and overall found the stay very comfortable The positives: - The location is very central and in walking distance to all the major attractions. - The hotels public areas and room are very clean and tidy. - The rooftop bar is a highlight - very relaxing and a nice place to wind down after the hustle and bustle of the city. - Staff are fantastic and go out of their way to assist The negatives: - My room was on the first floor near the elevator and stairs. As the hotel has tiled floors all noises can be heard from inside the room at all times. There is also construction works externally. Tip - ask for a quite room! - Had breakfast on two occasions. Both times there was no-one to greet me upon entry into the restaurant and no advice as to how breakfast operated. The buffet was small and didn't have widest selection. I would suggest picking up a coffee and croissant at a local Starbucks for a fraction on of the price! However the positives outway the negatives. I would consider staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corinna F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights last week with my partner, and honestly can't speak highly enough about it. I emailed one of the managers, Victor, ahead of our trip with various questions, and he answered all queries promptly and helpfully which gave me confidence before arriving, as I had booked this trip for my partner’s birthday present. I was a little concerned re the noise mentioned by other guests on Trip Adviser, but after emailing him about this, he put us in a room away from the construction work. I can honestly say though, we didn't hear any noise for the duration, wherever we were in the hotel. We actually spoke to another staff member about it whilst we were there, and he told us that they had blocked off the rooms nearest to the noise now - so they really do seem to be doing everything they can for their guests whilst the work is going on. The room was lovely, with a balcony and gorgeous bathroom. It was spotlessly clean as was the rest of the hotel. The roof terrace was beautifully designed and the perfect place to relax after a day's sight seeing, and the bar was very reasonable in terms of prices. Meanwhile the location was great as we walked everywhere which meant we really benefited from seeing as much of Barcelona as we could cram into three days! My only slightly negative comment (and I really am clutching at straws here) would be that the spotlights in the room flickered a bit at night time (once turned off) but this really didn't hinder sleep. All in all I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. What really made it for us was the friendly and courteous attitudes of all the staff. Nothing was too much trouble - from recommending restaurants, to booking taxis or giving us directions. For me, the behaviour of the staff is of utmost importance on a holiday, and every single one of them made us feel at home. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruby193
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from a 3 night stay at this hotel and I would recommend it. The hotel was lovely, very clean, well decorated & central only 10-15 minutes walk to most of the main sights. A little disappointed that the roof terrace bar was closed but I guess it is autumn even though we had great weather!!! Hotel staff seemed friendly and helpful although we didn't really use them much. Would definitely stay here again. Be careful when giving the taxi driver the name of the hotel as we were taken to NH Constanza and I've just read this has happened before so make sure they know the address!! As far as the building work is concerned are stay cover Monday and Tuesday and apart from a little noise on the Monday morning around 8 we were affected by any noise so maybe we were just lucky or others have been unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “central, chic and easy to find”
Reviews.Author: LesandPete
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel. Nice staff. Good location, a 10-15 minute walk to La Rambla. We also walked to the Gaudi house and the apartments. The rooms look good, nicely decorated, we had a lovely balcony room overlooking the street. Great triple glazing on the windows. I commented how quiet it was - until we opened the balcony doors and copped the morning traffic, but certainly not a problem, just funny! The only bed cover was the one in the website photos. It was made of a slippery satin type fabric, which stayed on the bed for about 5 mins once you were in it. I asked at reception for a blanket as it was late September and not sure how the a/c was going to be during the night. They gave me a blanket the size of a knee rug, made of very rough fabric, so small, I asked for 2. The next day, the housekeeping changed the 2 small ones for one large one (same rough synthetic fabric) which barely covered the bed. The satin one spent most of the night on the floor again, the small size blanket wanted to join it. Wifi was only in the reception area, which was a bit of a hassle. OK if you don’t have a laptop or ipad and need to use the hotel computers. There is cable in the room but ipads need wifi or 3G. I actually bought a 3G sim card for the ipad in Italy, but it didn’t work for Barcelona and wasn’t worth buying one for 4 days use. For a hotel of this standard, WiFi should be available in the rooms. The roof terrace was lovely, the restaurant was reasonable, however we opted to eat out for breakfast as we thought it should have been included in the price. We stayed in other hotels which were just as nice or cheaper, that included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Stay Oct 2011”
Reviews.Author: KsChris
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Constanza for 4 nights- Oct 9-12. Perfect location- not loud, but within walking distance to everything. Rooms were very clean, modern and very nice. Great shower. Loved the rood top bar. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. Next trip to Barcelona will definitley stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you are an early riser.”
Reviews.Author: djwoz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great value, and a great location. That what's we thought when we reserved our 3 night stay at the Hotel Constanza and when we checked in on Sunday afternoon. That all changed Monday morning when the jackhammers started rumbling on the construction site next door at around 9:00am. It was even worse the next morning. I called the front desk to complain and I was told the noise was from the construction next door. Fortunately, we were already planning on checking out. Otherwise we would have checked out early. When we checked out I complained about the noise. I asked the front desk clerk why I wasn't told about the construction next door when I reserved our room or when we checked in. I didn't get an answer. Just a "We're sorry for the inconvenience, we'll comp you one free breakfast". Unless you are an early riser I highly recommend that you do not stay here until the construction next door is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Only 'pros'!”
Reviews.Author: MilaLD
Reviews.Content: A fantastic, quiet location in the heart of Eixample, with walking distance to the main sites of BCN. Helpful staff with good tips of the city. Clean, modern rooms with tasty furniture and a decent bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: ironwinefan
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just five minutes walk from Urquinaona metro stop (yellow line) which makes it v.easy to get down to Barri Gotic. Our room on 5th floor was facing courtyard with small private balcony. Small but comfortable and with separate bathroom and excellent shower. Very quiet over the weekend, but possibly there is renovation noise during the week in site next door which has been flattened. Staff all helpful and spoke good English. Hotel feels elegant, modern and well-run. Unremarkable breakfast not up to standard of hotel - quite convenient however before a day of sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Doug S
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was really helpful and friendly (this young lad). The hotel rooms were more spacious than I initially thought, and there was a fridge and safe, very ideal for a city like Barcelona. The air-conditioning could be improved but overall, good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: SoCa1l26
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights pre-cruise at this hotel in early September. The hotel decor is a bit dark, but the room was stylish and modern if a little bit small. The bed was relatively comfortable, but one small complaint is the lack of significant blankets - just a very light comforter meant more for decoration than warmth. My wife was a bit chilly at night and we had to raise the temperature each evening a couple degrees. Staff was very helpful and spoke good English. They were very understanding and assistive when we believed we had a billing problem (which turned out not to be the case).

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Carmine G
Reviews.Content: I live and work in Manhattan, and don't mind being 10-15 minutes away from everything. My wife and I stayed for 4 days after a cruise, and picked this hotel because it was close enough to the tourist attractions to walk to them all without being right on top of them. The room is large and clean (for the record, we had a suite). The climate control was always too cold, even when set to 25*. The twin beds were too short (I am 6' tall and my feet would go over the edge of the bed), and the comforters will not cover an adult. The walls are paper thin, you will hear all of your neighbors. Finding anything but a news channel in English is next to impossible. There were mosquitoes in the lobby and the courtyard we had. The good outweighs the bad, however. The staff was fantastic, friendly and accommodating. Everything was immaculately clean. The beds had bedbug-proof covers (VERY important if you don't like throwing away all of your possessions). Computer access (although wifi access is a bit of a joke). La Rambla, Plaza Catalunya, La Sagrada Familia, the little mall on Avinguda del Portal de l'Àngel, the zoo at the south end of Sant Joan and even the port are all within a 10-30 minute walk. We even walked to Park Guell, but I wouldn't do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JFC1977
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 days. As far as European hotels go, the room and bath room size were large...(we came from Paris). It is about a 10 minute walk to Plaza Catalunya and about 15 to 20 to the heart of Las Ramblas. It is not the closest hotel to those places, but for the price and accomodations, it is worth it. It is also nice that they have a roof top bar for the night that you just want to chill or perhaps a night cap. Overall, service was good and staff are very helpful. Negatives: 1. No wifi in room, only cable with intermittent connection problems. 2. Only 1 person manning front desk, which means if he/she is called to assist a guest upstairs they lock the front door, so that no one can go in or out of hotel. This happened to us, but it was only a few minutes. I just think maybe it is better to have more than 1 person manning the desk. Would I go back? Yes I would.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Denise S S
Reviews.Content: Good boutique hotel in great location. Can walk to Gaudi sites, close to metro. Helpful staff with good English. BBC World and CNN available.... A nice change for Spain. Travelled with a friend so booked a suite. Lots of room and large balcony. Huge walk in shower. As others have said, insulation is a problem and a huge building project next door meant noise in the day but we were out so no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Annagiacobbe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights in september 2011.Very nice and well furnished hotel and very strategic place to visit Barca!! Breakfast was ok. Personnel was absolutely fantastic, really nice, available and The Hotel is new, clan and modern. The hotel is very good also for the price. I would reccomend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “You are in safe hands”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl S
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel after reading good reviews on trip advisor and I was not disappointed. We had a difficult journey, but on arriving at the hotel all my anxieties disappeared. We had a lovely greeting from a receptionist with excellent English and everything in the hotel was as it should be. The room was very clean and attractively decorated and we had a lovely balcony, which we had not asked for, which had all day sun. The decor was modern and pleasing to the eye and the bathroom, with a powerful and roomy shower, I would rate as excellent. The breakfast was an additional e10, but considering that we paid e3 for a cup of coffee elsewhere I consider this reasonable as the beverages were unlimited, so you could have 2 or 3 drinks plus food in the morning. All of the hotel staff were very helpful and spoke English well, and the hotel was clean and attractive throughout. We were close enough to walk to Las Ramlas and the harbour and the main tourist area of Barcelona, and I would chose this hotel again if I return. Also, we had no noise during the night and a very peaceful night;s sleep in a comfortable bed. It was a hot weekend and so the air conditioning was lovely, but weather enabled us to sit out on our balcony until midnight without even a cardigan (September). The only thing I could have wished for was coffee making facilities in our room, but this seems to be a common omission in many hotels now. Best hotel I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny single rooms with a view of a wall!”
Reviews.Author: smpotts13
Reviews.Content: This overall is a bargain hotel, with a slick look in a great part of town. However...I got a single room and wasn't told the real story. First floor, back of the hotel. Twin bed, tiny room. It had been redone and looked great, but did I mention...TINY. The window looked at a wall about 5 feet away. Little light made its way in. If you're looking for inexpensive single accommodations and only plan on sleeping there, then this might work for you. Oh...seemed really under-staffed while I was there. Up to you. I wouldn't have done it if I knew the real story on singles or would have upgraded to get larger room with terrace. Still a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “definitely will be back”
Reviews.Author: ajcJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel, well positioned. Staff were help full and assisted in every way. Took advice from trip advisor and had rooms away from construction and did not here anything at any time during our stay. Room we had was a suite and was modern and large enough. Children's room was adequate and all I woulld want is a view of the streets of Barcelona. Major problem was no English TV channels but not a major concern as all we did was sleep,get up early and return late that evening. Internet only in the lobby should look at wi fi in the rooms. Never eat at restaurant but it looked good

Reviews.Title: “Would defiantly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Dragonbabe
Reviews.Content: Was a bit dubious about booking this hotel after reading what other people had said about the nearby building works and the noise problems, but as our hotel would just be a place to sleep at night we went for it and am so glad I did. Hotel constanza was perfect for my husband, 2 children and myself. We stayed in a suite on 3rd floor towards back of the hotel Wednesday-Sunday and were not woken by the sound of hammering, guests in other rooms or the cleaning staff and I am a very light sleeper. The room was very large with a smaller room off for the children and a large bathroom and a small furnished balcony where we enjoyed sitting early am and evening. The room was spotlessly clean a big factor when I choose a hotel. Particulary loved the shower. Only thing I could fault about the room was it's lack of English speaking tv channels and no wi fi both of which we were prepared for so was not a major problem. The staff were very pleasant, helpful and unobtrusive, we much prefer to be able to come and go as we please so once again perfect for us. Initialy the hotel seemed to be quite out of the way, but once you get a feel for the area you soon realise how close you are to all the major areas and we mainly walked our way around Barcelona with a little help from the hop on hop off bus service to reach the further afield attractions. All in all we were very pleased with Hotel Constanza, it was very good value for money by Barcelona standards and we would defiantly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent mid-price option in the Eixample”
Reviews.Author: Experienced_11
Reviews.Content: What a nice, friendly boutique hotel in Barcelona! Close to everything, including three metro stations, and within walking distance of the Barri Gotic and several of the main sites in the Eixample. The decor is chic, modern. The rooms are well appointed. They offer a basic breakfast buffet for 10 euros. The highlight of our stay was the super friendly staff, always happy to help. How nice it is to be received every time we arrived with a warm smile, particularly on the part of charming Samuel and Victor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge room, quaint hotel on a quite street but centrally located.....”
Reviews.Author: WrldVoyagers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. It is centrally located on a quite street just a blocks from Placa Catalunya. The building was beautiful. The rooms were modern and well appointed with all the standard amenities. We booked a suite at an excellent price and the room was huge. The staff was always available, helpful, and pleasant. They hailed taxis when needed and even made sure our taxi driver understood our destinations. We would definitely stay here again. We read other reviews about the construction noise, but we never heard any of it. Finally, air conditioning....worked wonderfully, which is unusual in Europe. Great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Akrep81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Constanza for 4 nights and my stay was lovely. The location is great. The hotel is based in the Eixample but just minutes away from Plaça Catalunya, only a block away from Gaudi's Casa Calvet and 15-20 minute walk away from the sites in Barri Gotic, Las Ramblas and Eixample. The hotel building is nice and our room had a balcony. The room had modern design and was comfortable and large. The hotel staff was lovely and helpful; the room service was good. The hotel is quiet inside and you don’t hear your neighbours. However, there is no wi-fi in the rooms (only cable connection, which doesn’t work with tabs and smart phones). Wi-fi access is in the lobby only. The street is noisy but if you keep the windows shut then there is no problem. The breakfast area is depressing, there are no windows and they did not have black tea (just herbal teas). The breakfast was €10 which is a good price. One more point, the air conditioning was in full speed, the lobby and the hotel corridors were like -10 degrees. Some may like it but we thought it was too cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Family of Five in Barcelona with a great location,”
Reviews.Author: Cobra199
Reviews.Content: We loved our weeklong stay here last April 2011. Location was perfect walking distance to Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas. We had a one bedroom suite and it was perfect for a family of five. The Metro was close by so all attractions were easily accessible,

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Gulks
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel! Fantastic location with a 5 min walk to the Cathedral and Gothic Center and 5 min to Passeig de Gràcia. Rooms were clean, big and beautiful. Comfortable beds, great terrace, modern bathrooms and great air conditioning. The hotel reception and concierge were incredibly helpful with ideas, maps and planning. (The lobby also has 2 computers which are open to guests and free wifi in the lobby.) I highly recommend this hotel to anyone touring Barcelona!!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Deardre N
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean and comfortable room, helpful and knowledgeable front desk.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, we enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Happytouristsdurham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Constanza for two nights in June 2011, prior to boarding our Cruise Ship. It is ideally situated for seeing Barcelona, being a short walk from Placa Catalonia. The room was well appointed, with a comfortable bed and spacious, well-equipped bathroom. The staff on Reception were extremely helpful and spoke very good English. We would have no hesitation in returning in the future,

Reviews.Title: “Could be perfect without the construction noise”
Reviews.Author: GuaguaBeijing
Reviews.Content: The photos on the hotel's website tell the truth. We booked a suite for 6 nights during our recent stay in Barcelona. The room is very spacious in European standards, with modern decoration and facilities. Knowing we have a kid traveling with us, the hotel staffs have changed the sofa in living room into a queen sized bed, very considerate. One thing we liked the most of the hotel is the convenience to public transport (metro line 1 and 4), and to the shopping and dining areas nearby. We even took the courage to walk to Sagrada Familia, within 25 minutes. The free Internet in Rooney worked also very well. The only down side of the hotel is the construction works taking place right next to the hotel. Sometimes when we were in the room during day time on weekdays, the noise was just unbearable... Pity. But this forced us to get out of the room more often and enjoy the beautiful sunshine in Barcelona. Check with hotel if the works are finished, or make your own choice if you don't really want to stay in room during day time. By the way, the terrace of hotel was closed due to the works...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Jeremy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. A few minutes walk from Plaza Catalunya and a few from Barri Gothic. The rooms are all very stylish and well maintained. The neighborhood is quiet in the evening but you are still blocks from the nightlife so its actually a blessing. Rooftop bar was closed for most of our stay but reopened on our last night in Barcelona and its a hip little place as well. The staff was fantastic and accommodated every need we had even when we were forced to change some booking plans at the last minute. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: GusVlad
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights. Very good location. The hotel is only about a 10 minute walk to La Rambal which is about as far as you should be if you want a quiet hotel, which this certainly is. We booked a suite which is capable of sleeping 4 people for only 120 euro per night. There is a very nice rooftop bar which is open in afternoons and evenings. The front desk staff is first rate. They had many good suggestions regarding resturants and quickest ways to get to all of the sites. Very nice modern rooms. Awesome bathroom!! Consider a multi day subway pass which gives you unlimited use of the extensive subway system and bus lines. Overall an excellent experience and we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: TeeP17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and were impressed by the facilities, cleanliness, location and service. Reception recommended visiting Ciudad Comtal for the best tapas in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Donidoni
Reviews.Content: In 5 days we had to take the underground only twice. If you don't wear high-heels, there is no need, because everything is so close. Even to the beach you can easily walk. That way, you see a lot more of the city - and earn your dinner in one of the delicious nearby tapas bars. The hotel is very stylish, rooms are large enough and the staff friendly and helpful. We could recommend Hotel Constanza to everybody looking for a central place in Barcelona. Ours was a private trip, but on business it should also be convenient. I saw PCs and other equipment. Upstairs, there is a beautiful rooftop bar.Unfortunately, it is closed very often. It would have been nice to stay there in the late afternoon, before leaving again for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “great location & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: family44
Reviews.Content: Glad we chose the Hotel Constanza for our first stay in Barcelona! We were able to walk to Placa Catalunya in about 5 minutes - the Passeig de Gracia was also close, as well as the Gothic quarter. The area felt safe. The suite was comfortable for a family of four, with twin beds and the children in a sturdy sofa bed. The price of the room was good compared to other hotels that we had been looking at - although breakfast was not included. This was not a problem as we went to nearby cafes and a bakery to buy croissants, sandwiches etc. Our room was at the front of the hotel - 5th floor - and we did not experience any noise from traffic or construction (we were out most of the time).The staff were excellent - very helpful from the minute I called to make the reservation to our checkout. They were extremely prompt at fixing our mini bar, which was not cold. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok.”
Reviews.Author: Travel7744
Reviews.Content: Plus: friendly staff. Good location with walking distance to old city and to bus station for airport bus. Minus: WiFi was working but with very low and therefore not usable datarate and in the lobby only.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel...would return!”
Reviews.Author: dang9973
Reviews.Content: Very clean. well laid out rooms. Minimalist, boutique style hotel. Great location. Only complaint was WiFi in lobby only worked on sporadically.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but ...”
Reviews.Author: BertVana
Reviews.Content: ... but the WiFi didn't work ... and the roof terrace wasn't available due to other private party ... breakfast was terrible, you better have something outside People were friendly, nice rooms, 5min walking from Plaza Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutiquey hotel not far from anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: drboothy
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, well furnished, lovely bathrooms, very modern. Helpful staff at the front desk. We had a room at the back with a balcony, great for the evening sun. Only 5mins walk from placa catalunya where you can catch the aerobus to the airport for €5.30. The surrounding area is pretty quiet, but you can walk to the best bits easily, or get the metro. We were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab location, DONT GET A DISCOUNTED SUITE!”
Reviews.Author: ChelcOz
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, modern hotel in a fabulous location, a short stroll to Placa Catalunya, perfect. I booked a suite which was discounted due to scheduled works on the building next door which was to be between 9-5pm each day. I understood this and booked accordingly. 1st issue, for 2 days now, works started at at or slightly before 8am...I have 1 more night here, hopefully doesnt happen tomorrow before 9am. 2nd issue, all suites have 2 x single beds and not double/queen beds. The rooms are very clean, spacious and comfortable. Staff are helpful. Would stay here again however would stay well clear of the rooms adjacent to the building works....I have moved from 3rd floor suite to a room 203 and it's no better :( Other than that, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: HMM1956
Reviews.Content: There is currently construction going on so unless you are prepared to be woken by the sound of pounding jackhamers and drills, I would avoid staying here until its over. Staff are friendly but unable to resolve this problem. We were moved to room 114 on lower floor at the back but the vibrations continued to rattle the windows and this room (Suite) has the additional inconvenience of plumbing noise - every time someone flushes a toilet or takes a shower it sounds like a tropical storm. Torture!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Fantastic City!”
Reviews.Author: FalcoG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in a very nice street, you can easily walk around to the most important sites of this beautiful city. The staff was extremely helpful, funny and very welcoming My room was great, very well appointed, very clean and comfortable, the breakfast was perfect, the decor of the hotel very nice, bathroom was excellent, shower great! Never heard any noise from the construction during my two night stay. Very happy to have chosen this hotel for my stay thanks to Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: KatieVinChicago
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great - clean, reasonably priced, centrally located, and nice front desk staff. They even let me see another room when I wanted a balcony instead of a terrace. I deducted one star since there is some serious construction going on next door and it was never mentinoned to us by the front desk or in any signs. it started promtply at 8am during the week (not on weekends), It didn't really bother us since it was a perfect wake up call, but I wish the front desk apologized for the inconvenience and provided guests free earplugs. There are computers to use in the lobby, but remember your ethernet cord if you are bringing your laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiredchick224
Reviews.Content: The reception desk staff was very nice, the decor lovely, and it was in a great location. The only downside was construction noise from next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the rate”
Reviews.Author: travelerlots
Reviews.Content: stayed in a suite. very nice and very large especially for a European city. staff is super polite and helpful. two things that need to be worked out are the no wireless in the rooms. a 2 foot cable isn't cutting it. also the lack of a single English (or any other language but Spanish) channel on the TV. with such international clientele the hotel should really accommodate otherwise great spot with barrio Gothic about 4 blocks away and plaza Cataluna about the same. cant beat it especially with the way rates have exploded in Spain this year. no idea why since the economy is shot and no one can afford them anyway

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ClareCheshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Constanza for a night after moving from another hotel. It was absolutely perfect for a city break in Barcelona. It is a lovely, modern hotel, which has been very thoughfully and tastefully decorated. Our room was very spacious and had a lovely bathroom. There is free wi-fi in the reception area and a very nice roof-top bar. The hotel is very ideally siutated and is within walking distance of the Ramblas and the Placa da Catalunya, but it is quietly situated. There is some building work going on next door, which other reviewers have commented on, but they did not do any work at all on the Saturday when we were there. If you're looking for a great place to stay in Barcelona, then I really would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic breakfast, amazing price-quality!”
Reviews.Author: PacaMari
Reviews.Content: I am glad I stayed at this hotel. I stayed at the fith flour, room 511, very big!, nice super king size bed, nice baby cradle, wonderfull toilet, it was big, clean and comfortable. Very clean the whole room, we asked for dinner at the room, amazing food!!!, super fast service, wonderful salad, very tasty sandwich, my husband who is very delicate with meat, found his stake awsom, I love natural juices and I asked for Pomelo...ummmm it was fantastic! Nice parking just under the hotel, nice location, and best of all a real anti-ox breakfast! IT WAS GORGEOUS!!! Just beside the hotel, 100 m2 the Illa Shopping center...fantastic! Full of wonderful shops...do not miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with a couple of issues”
Reviews.Author: Glenno11
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking this is a good place to stay. It is very centrally located - close to Pl de Catalunya, on the border of the Eixample and the old city. We had a good sized room looking onto the rear of the block. Staff were very friendly. There were a couple of issues: - the construction noise (which other reviewers have noted), this seemed to start at about 10am most days. It does look like it will be going for a while. - the hot water in the showers had a strange petrol like smell. On enquiring we were told that this was due to monthly cleaning of the hot water system. We stayed twice over the course of two weeks and the smell was there both times. This needs to be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Very central but still quiet - very clean and lovely modern decor.”
Reviews.Author: yvonne_cathcart
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a quiet street, yet it is very close to Place de Catalunya which is where the official bus tours begin and also where you get the bus to the airport. There are great shops, cafes, bars and restaurants all within walking distance. The hotel was very clean, modern and comfortable. We had a little suite at the back with a lovely terrace for sitting out. Unfortunately there was a lot of work going on in the building next door so we were woken quite early each morning by the sound of drilling and demolition.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room, view on the wall, strong noise before 8 A.M.”
Reviews.Author: whitecissor
Reviews.Content: Single room to small (less than 10 m2) Window on a light-well, no natural light at all, big wall at 1 meter distance. Very noisy hotel on the rooms floor. And because of a site just beside the hotel, very strong noise on friday morning (pneumatic drill) before 8 A.M. Total of the bill, without breakfast : 360 Euros I asked for a reduction price, I have to write a mail to the manager (no comment....)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: szzoltan
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Our suite had a lot of space, and it was clean. The colors are very dark brown and black with tiny LED lightning, so the whole house has dark feeling. The bar on the roof is nothing special, and has only limited view to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable, economical and pleasant stay in Europe so far.”
Reviews.Author: AlamedaRetirees
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to see a spacious,bright and clean room We went according to Frommer's recommendation for the most economical "Boutique" hotel in Barcelona and verified their recommentation through Tripadvisor and we were extremely pleased with our choice. The concierge staff was helpful, friendly and attentive. The location of the hotel was excellent. We were able to walk to almost everything of importance and where we could not, there was a metro staion close by (which is very easy to use). This saved us much euros on cabs. The hotel is in a safe and beautiful neighborhood with many places to eat close by. I would ask for a suite with a balcony since we enjoyed looking out on the city's landscape. My only negative comment would be that we found their breakfast to be a bit pricey but it is right there on the premises and we took advantage of that to get an early start. It might have been less if we included it in the price of the room when we made reservations. There is construction going on next door, but it was our wake up call each morning and got us to get moving. This started at 8:00 a.m. and they did not work on the weekend. Overall, we will be returning to the Hotel Constanza within the next two years or less.

Reviews.Title: “Best value we've found in Europe!!”
Reviews.Author: benny001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Constanza for one night on a road trejo through France and Spain. We were very disappointed to only have one night here as the entire experience was fabulous. We arrive after a trip from Madrid late in the evening and the guy on reception couldn't do enough to help with advising re parking and where to eat. The room was enormous and had a small balcony over the street. A little noisy but nothing to worry about. All in all hard to believe how good the experience was and compared with some four and five star places. Have stayed at a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Modern,quiet hotel with large and comfortable rooms close to the city centre"”
Reviews.Author: Echoes8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the city centre within walking distance of 5 minutes from Plaza Catalunya. Although it is a busy district, Calle Bruc is a quiet and safe road. The hotel is apprpaching lux facilities in lower prices, this is why i consider it value for money. I dont say it is cheap, but it is worthy 100%. The variety in the breakfast is not very big but whatever you choose to have is really tasty and fresh. Great coffe machine compared to other that suck. Modern rooms with great, clean and luxurious bathrooms.Staff friendly and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Fab on all fronts!”
Reviews.Author: hedgetrimmer
Reviews.Content: very comfortable, clean and welcoming. Ideally situated close to Catalunya Square, which gives access to city tour busses, the airport bus stop, and La Rambla. We had a huge room. Breakfast plentiful and fresh. Would definitely recommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: AlkmaarTraveller
Reviews.Content: Nice and central place to stay. Good beds and clean room. Bit noisy because of the "hoteldoors" with electronic lock, which you have to close fermly. Very helpfull and friendly staff at the reception. They helped us to get last minute tickets for FC Barcelona-Osasuna.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: mickesolna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a weekend. It was clean and fresh, latest design. Centrally located, close to everything. Nice helpful staff. I will gladly recommend it to friends who will be visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you do not need to be in the center of the old city”
Reviews.Author: SAjulio
Reviews.Content: This was a very convenient place for my business purposes and proximity the the shopping areas. Very nice contemporary retrofit. Helpful staff. Many places to have breakfast in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, clean, friendly service and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: germany117
Reviews.Content: The staff of the hotel is friendly and helpfull. The hotel is modern equiped. Each room has a flatscreen, rainshower, aircondition, save and minibar. Most important it is very clean. The furniture is really stylish and cosy. We had a room facing the backyard. It had a huge balcony. Although there is a kindergarten nearby you could not hear a thing through the windows. The Hotel is perfectly located near Placa Catalunya and the old town of Barcelona. The metro station is nearby. You also got a lot of small bars and restaurants around. There are also two computers in the lobby, where you can surf for free. After a long day of sightseeing I liked a lot to sit on the balcony and enjoy the afternoon sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelerBD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a charming, quiet block walking distance from most major tourist attractions. The staff was helpful and friendly and let us check in at 9 a.m. after an overnight flight from the states, which was much appreciated. The rooms include a beautiful balcony, although the view is nothing special. The rooms were clean and modern and reasonably sized for a Europen hotel and the bathrooms were large. And at about $180 American per night, the price was just right.

Reviews.Title: “A trully lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: catherinejane6
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we could have asked for. Our room was comfortable, clean, with room serviced everyday. The shower was brillant. It is so convenient for all tourist sites and transport, which was so important as my husband has MS. To take a taxi anywhere was so reasonable. We could not have been more pleased with this hotel and can honestly say it is not just a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: RomanoLuca
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience in Barcelona and i've never been regretful for staying at Hotel Constanza..First of all, hotel staff is very helpful and friendly..They always try to give you more information about somewhere you want to go...Hotel rooms were very clean, modern and well equipped with large flat screen tv, mini bar and internet access.
