And the location is excellent..It takes just 10 min. to get to the center. If i have a chance to be in Barcelona, i'll definitely stay at Constanza without no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel with all the basics in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAussie1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in April 2011 and it was very comfortable and in a good location. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated with free internet and a desk. Check-in and out was easy and they had my room ready early which was great. The only contra was that it was a little noisy early in the morning as you can hear the water running from other people's showers.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: colmanMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located to all the places you need to be in Barcelona. It is new and modern and the rooms very clean and spacious. All the physical things are there to make this a great place to stay. But the one thing missing is the attention to detail and the feeling of friendliness of the staff. With out sounding too petty the Hotel staff could not supply any hot water for a cup of tea on Sunday “because the restaurant is closed”. The foyer seems to be a bit dark and unwelcoming. The breakfast room was in windowless back room of a restaurant (much better to eat in the front part that is open to the public). It all felt a bit clinical. I guess that is the difference between a good place to stay and a great place to stay. For the location, price and services offered I thought Hotel Constanza was good value. Having recently stayed at some other hotels in Europe were the staff always had a smile and went out of their way to make you welcome, I felt the staff were disappointing, sure it a small point, but it is those things that can make all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: speckster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Constanza for 8 nights in late March. While I do tend to be a princess about my hotels, I decided to do this trip on the cheap. We're used to spending on average $400.00 per night on a hotel room, we got the Junior Suite for $150.00 per night. Honestly, that worried me a bit, but the reviews on TA were solid, so we took the risk. Room was nicely appointed, and quite spacious for Europe. Nice shower and decor is simple and clean. Really, the only difference between this hotel experience and our experience at other, more expensive hotels comes down to the details... After check in, we were pointed toward the elevators, and made our way to our room (no bellman to take the baggage). This isn't a problem to us, but it is different. The room was made up every day, but there was no turndown service (again, something that I find to actually be a tad bit annoying in the more expensive hotels, I never seem to have any privacy, there's always housekeeping knocking on the door trying to feed me chocolate). There was no WiFi in the room, but there was a cable connection for my laptop, and there was no extra charge for this (actually, a welcome difference from the hotels we are used to). No room service, but we never use that anyway except to get a bucket of ice from time to time. They did, however provide us with ice buckets when we asked, as there is a kitchen on site for breakfast, etc. The two twin's made up into a king were incredibly firm mattresses. It didn't bother my husband, but I was popping Tylenol like candy the entire trip. If you like firm mattresses, you'll love it, it you're like me, you may very well be in hell. I don't fault the hotel for this, as I've had overly firm mattresses in more expensive accommodations as well, so I can't blame this on the cheaper rate. Ooh, here's one weird thing though. When you leave the room, and take out your key (which switches off the lights, tv, etc.) it actually turns off the thermostat! So, every time we came back to our room it was freezing cold. Good news is that the heat is really effective, so it was warm in about 10 minutes. Front desk staff were helpful in suggesting restaurants, Hakim, especially went out of his way to come up with ideas for non-Tapas restaurants for us after we were Tapased out in three nights. They also took care of faxing our passports to the car rental company when I screwed up and forgot to bring them along when we picked up the car. Overall, I've got to say, that for a savings of $250.00 per night over what I'm used to spending, this place was a steal. Really, all I care about is the quality and cleanliness of the room, and this room was quite comparable with the hotels that I'm used to. When you think about it, I'm paying an awful lot for a chocolate on my pillow in those other places!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little pretentious and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Ceciliaantolini
Reviews.Content: No wifi.. Breakfast nice but not special. Too expansive actually...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and amazing value for money”
Reviews.Author: TelAvivMark
Reviews.Content: I was responsible for finding the hotel in Barcelona that could accommodate a group of 15 runners and their partners who came to run the Barcelona Marathon. I did an internet search of moderate Barcelona hotels and checked reviews on Trp Advisor and the one hote that stood out with both moderate prices and excellent reviews was the Constanza. Having returned a few days ago from Barcelona, it has been proven that what people have written about the hotel in the past is absolutely true and the hotel was an excellent choice. The central location but without being in the hustel and bustle of the Rambla area was a perfect choice. After a busy day and when rest was necessary, this was possible in the quiet and comfortable rooms. The staff was freindly and accommodating, the lobby was comfortable and warm, everything about the hotel was tastefully furnished and decorated and very clean. In summary, I recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for an inexpensive hotel in central Barcelona. You wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly unobtrusive service and good facilities”
Reviews.Author: SecretStopper
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as one we could walk to from the Airport bus final terminus in Placa Catalunya and then easily explore Barcelona on foot or by bus. Reception staff were friendly and helpful and all spoke English. Standard double room space and facilities were excellent, clean and modern. The room safe was useful, shower was spacious and very wet and the bed was comfortable. New towels and bedding after two nights- we stayed for three. Room 301 at the back of the hotel was very quiet although the front is on a quiet side road and should also be quiet. No noisey bars, etc. within earshot. We managed to walk to most central places of interest on our list and caught the standard bus services from Placa Catalunya for the others. There is a reasonable selection of good value places to eat within a short walk home, or out if you want to try somewhere different for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly convenience, nicely wrapped”
Reviews.Author: GS_nl
Reviews.Content: Three nights father and 12-yr old son, visiting Barcelona for Gaudí, FC Barcelona and tapas. Hotel Constanza is excellently located with Urquinaona underground around the corner and Pl Catalunya (airport bus, city buses, underground) a 5-10 min walk. Just two blocks north of the old city, and a 15-20 minutes' walk from the Gaudí extravagances on Passeig de Grácia. Double room on 1st floor, on the street front. Street noise was not a hindrance (windows isolated), early morning sound of drain pipes from rooms above and voices from restaurant starting up below were. Excellent beds and a very good shower made up for this, though. Room internet (free) was wired only. However, wireless (free) was available in the lobby, as were two connected PCs. Staff was helpful and friendly, interested, knowledgeable. Breakfast buffet was excellent and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “In the center”
Reviews.Author: ank_lambers
Reviews.Content: When you need a simple and clean place really in the middle of the center of Barcelona this it is! Friendy sevice and simple rooms, but fantastic location

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel with fab staff in great location”
Reviews.Author: echo10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights to celebrate my birthday. Although this hotel is only a 2* it is certainly much more than that. We stayed in a double room on the 5th floor. The room was clean, modern and well equipped with large flat screen tv, mini bar and internet access. The bathroom was excellent - the shower has to be one of the best I've used!! The staff were friendly and helpful at all times. In fact, it was definately at least a 3* if not more! I wouldn't have been disappointed if I'd booked it as a 4*. Well worth the money!! I highly recommend and would certainly go back there if we returned to Barcelona. The location was good too. In a quieter residential area just outside the centre. It only took about 10mins to walk into the centre and we were near a metro too.,

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: vmmcr
Reviews.Content: Madler, the Algerian reception clerk, was particularly nice and gave us good tips about transports and things to do. The vending machine at the lobby such have more options and filled more often.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Best location!”
Reviews.Author: Lindaaaaaaaa
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay in this hotel. Staff was nice. Room very clean! Shower amazingly good. Patio with two seets, really nice. Minibar, not expensive and to use as a fridge as well. I did not have breakfast at the hotel, so cannot recommend that, but we preferred having breakfast in the city. Barcelona is great, love it! Especially tcitypart El Born with it's little tapas restaurants and cocktail bars. two kind of bad things at the hotel: there is only wifi in the lobby, not in the rooms. In the room you can here you neighbours walk. BUT I WOULD DEFINATELY GO BACK TO THIS HOTEL, everything is at walking distance and the subway is really close. Taxis are also nog that expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: trlar
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a 2 night stay in December 2010 based on the rating and reviews here and I wasn't disappointed. After reading the reviews I was prepared for the noise problems mentioned by other reviewers and had brought earplugs to sleep with, and a cable to get internet access from my room. My friend borrowed a cable from the reception. We stayed in two single rooms. Both rooms were on the first floor facing a tiny interior yard/shaft. This is a common solution in Barcelona but may disappoint visitors who are used to daylight and a view to other than a grey wall. We appreciated being able to turn off the aircon at night and sleeping with the window ajar. The rooms were small but well laid out. Their decor is stylish-on-a-budget. The bathroom even had a small bath tub. We had requested quiet rooms and our rooms at least had no noise from outside the hotel. But as mentioned earlier there is a lot of noise around the clock from people passing through the tileclad hallways, inadverently slamming doors that haven't been soundproofed and chairs being moved about in the surrounding rooms. Upon arrival one of the rooms didn't have any toiletpaper and the instrucions for the safe were missing. After the instrucions were given it was discovered that the safe couldn't be locked with a personal code. This was fixed later, but meant that there was no place to store valuables the first day. The other room was ok but it's safe was difficult to lock requiring up to 20 attemps before locking. We stayed for 2 nights and during the stay I had to have my keycard reconfigured twice because it failed to unlock the door to the room. Staff was very accommodating when these problems occurred, but they are clearly let down by faulty and unstable technical solutions. I tried the breakfast buffet. It was ok and a good choice if you don’t mwant to start the day roaming the streets searching for a place outside the hotel . The hotels breakfast is served in a rather uninspiring windowless room. To sum up: I recommend the hotel because it is very well located, the staff is helpful, and the rooms are ideal for visitors who spend most of their time away from the hotel and don’t need much space. It is also smoke-free. WORD OF ADVICE TO HOTEL MANAGEMENT: it takes very little to improve the user experience of the hotel. The noise problem encountered by so many guests can easily, cheaply and swiftly be solved by mounting feltpads under the legs of all the chairs and other moveable pieces of furniture, and by mounting transperant adhestive pvc bumpers (gotas protectoras) on the doors of the rooms, wardrobes, the fronts of the minibar-fridges and on the drawers of the night tables. Alternatively you can fit the rooms with carpets, but that is a costly solution and personally I appreciate and prefer tiled hotelroom floors that are easy to keep clean, don't become smelly over time, and better for guests suffering from allergies and asthma. Also provide free wireless internet access in the rooms. And opt for stable technical solutions when purchasing systems for locking the doors to the rooms, safes etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JoVee
Reviews.Content: I booked my accommodation based on previous trip advisor comments and was not disappointed. The hotel was impressive as soon as you walk in, very modern fittings and furniture. Location was great - easily accessible from Plaza Catalunya. I even managed to walk back to the plaza for the Aeropuerto Bus; walking distance to major attractions, eg Las Ramblas, La Sagrada Familia, Born & Barrio Gottic. My single room was clean and comfortable. I was on the 1st floor (room 111) but it was not noisy so was able to sleep well. Only minor comment was the location of the fixture for the towels which I kept on bumping into coming out of the shower. Room was maintained daily and was spic and span evertime I am back from my sightseeing. Reception people were nice and friendly. Always ready to answer my questions for directions. I had breakfast once and it was good value for 10 Euro. However, there are lots of options around the hotel. I liked the patiserie Caba for their yummy pastries and bread. They also have free internet access on the 2 computers in the lobby which was great for me to check on my email messages. As a solo traveller this hotel was great for me. I highly recommend this hotel for the above reasons and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great as allways”
Reviews.Author: Patricia169
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect especially for the location- 8 minutel walking to Placa Catalunya, really nice and helpfull staff and price. This was already my 3rd stay in this hotel, I would recommend it so for the groups so for the families.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel with excellent qualities”
Reviews.Author: dckmo
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at Constanza in December 2010; highly recommend it and would chose to stay again in a heart beat. If you are staying during the Summer and want to enjoy the sea view/sunshine in your room then it may not be the best option; if your priority is more to explore the city, then it's a perfect place. Room: The Single Room was very small, but such is the case with any other hotels, not unique to Constanza. Though small and no view (window was facing the inside of the building), it was very clean, no dust, and comfortable with nice firm bed and good bedding. Bathroom also very clean and comfortable to use. I'm fussy with bathrooms, and the bathtub didn't look quite clean/new enough to take a bath in, but it was more than sufficient to take a nice hot shower with good water pressure. Rooms equipped with fridges. Free wi-fi in the lobby area only but I had signals in my room and was able to use them. Staff: There were some comments in the past reviews about unfriendly staff but my experience couldn't have been more different. I interacted with 3-4 different staff during my stay and everyone was very friendly, helpful, spoke good English, and offered great help with directions / making reservations, etc. Noise: Again this was mentioned as negative in the past, but I didn't have any problem during my stay despite near-full occupancy. The doors and walls were thin so I can imagine the noise becoming an annoying issue if there are rowdy stag-weekend type of group staying in the hotel. That's just bad luck, and at this price range the noise issue would be the same anywhere else unless you are staying in 4-5 star hotels. Area: Very central location and walking distance to most tourist attractions yet on a quiet street so no noise from outside. I am a female single traveler but felt perfectly safe walking back from Passeig de Grancia / Las Rambla area (taking the main street detour) in the 11PM hours. Easy to find the way from Plaza Catalunya (around the corner from Casa Calvet); I took the Airport Bus and it took me about 10-15mns with a big suitcase. Supermarket nearby (2-3 minutes), plenty of cafes to take breakfast in (I really liked the deli/cafe by Tetian Station (Southwest corner of Gran Via / P. de Sant Joan).

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay in a wonderful city!”
Reviews.Author: CyprusElena
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Barcelona and Constanza Hotel. Both the city and the hotel were great. We got a suite which was large and very comfortable. Everyone in the hotel was helpful and very very kind!! The hotel is very near to the city centre and nearby there are many different cafes and restaurants to try.. Barcelona is a city to remember and want to visit again and again and so is Constanza Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Four star comfort at two star prices!”
Reviews.Author: nsahgal
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at Hotel Constanza. The hotel is clean, totally renovated with modern fittings and located within a 5 - 10 min walk to Plaza de Catalunya. Several other major sights such as Casa Batllo and Casa Mila are also within walking distance and others can be easily reached using the metro. The service was pleasant. We would recommend Hotel Constanza to those who want to be close to the Plaza but away from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice city hotel in good central location”
Reviews.Author: SuzyLin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights the week before Christmas and were very pleased with the quality and location of the Constanza. I did not think we would get such a good hotel for the price! The room was spacious and the decor is modern, understated and elegant. The bed was comfortable and the en-suite shower excellent. We opted for breakfast at a reasonable extra 10 euros each for the last two mornings and were pleasantly surprised at the choice. We helped ourselves to tortilla (a bit too salty for our taste), ham, cheese, croissants, cakes, pastries, fresh fruit, fruit salad, filled rolls, hard boiled eggs and tomatoes. We hope to return to Barcelona next year as we just did not have time to see everything we wanted it and we will definitely return to the Constanza.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location with VERY THIN WALLS!!”
Reviews.Author: eplymouth
Reviews.Content: There is really only one complaint about this wonderful hotel. There is absolutely no insulation between the rooms. We could hear our neighbors cough or talk and when they were intimate, it sounded like they could be laying in bed next to us. This made sleep very difficult. I'm sure it is not an easy thing to fix, but this is a big problem that eventually will cause people to stop coming to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: toonrobins
Reviews.Content: Really pleased to stay at the Constanza. Help desk staff were extremely helpful. Nothng was too much trouble for anyone. Ideally placed, only took about 6/7 minutes to be in Placa Catalunya and access for Metro. Rooms were fine, not huge, but ideal for a weekend away. The rooms were absolutely clean. Area was very peaceful and not noisy at all. Would stay again if going back to Barcelona. Ideal if you want to go shopping, only a few minutes walk. Can thoroughly recommend the stadium tour at the Nou Camp all of the family enjoyed it. Went to the Barca v Sociadad game on Sunday night and was amazing. Magic Fountains were fabulous and worth a visit. Only downside got ripped off in restaurant in Las Ramblas. Get you in on food deal, but then charge you 12 euro's for a coca cola, so beware! All in all, great hotel, fabulous sights, lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, helpful, professional front desk staff (all of them).”
Reviews.Author: Papipoka
Reviews.Content: Great location in Barcelona, good value, excellent and reasonably priced restaurant right next door for breakfast and lunch (formerly owned by the hotel?). I had made separate reservations for some friends to join us for 2 of the 4 days we stayed, and the hotel immediately notified me to make sure I had not made duplicate reservations, etc. Anna who seemed to be in charge has a great team at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jojomaneana
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Constanza. Location was very good, close to everything. Very clean and nice rooms. We liked the free access to computers and internet in the lobby. Good price. Perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to relax after any amazing day in this beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: PetrosKaplanidis
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, spacious rooms , a beautiful cafe , helpful staff and good design .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, as always”
Reviews.Author: summersso
Reviews.Content: Third time I've stayed here, always an excellent experience, fantastic service and location. A real gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rest in the centre”
Reviews.Author: Marcipan11
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice for sightseeing. Cheap hotel at very good place, 5 minutes walk to Pl. Catalunya, Ramblas, Pass. de Gracia, Arc de Triomf, Estacio del Nord. Free Internet in the hall!!!! If you want to print, they solve it... Kind staff. Nice terrace at he top of the building. Small, but comfortable rooms. The only negative thing, that sometimes you hear your neighbours....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug3719
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short break in Barcelona and stayed at the Hotel Constanza. The hotel was spotlessly clean, modern, stylish and just a short walk from the centre of town. A fantastic stay. Comfortable, nicely decorated rooms and fantastic bathrooms with quite possibly the best shower ever! Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, boutique hotel. Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: carters_westwood
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. Excellent value for money , close to all amenities but quiet enough to sleep !!! Staff friendly and helpful. Estupendo.

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons (more Cons)...”
Reviews.Author: Well_Travelled_Dubs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a few weeks ago (October) for 3 nights with my wife. We have very mixed reviews on this hotel for a number of reasons. Being the type of people who research in depth before travelling anywhere new, I was surprised that some of the good & bad comments we read all seemed to miss several key issues. Alas, I hope you find this review as helpful as some of our other reviews which people have commented on. (Apologies for the length of this review, but like others we’ve posted, we want to give everyone the full picture.) We booked with the hotel directly – having read some horrific tales about pre-booking various hotels via alternative websites. Having the knowledge of research behind us, we were not expecting to be awestruck as we arrived (it’s not the usual type of hotel we’d stay in) – and sadly, our expectations proved right. Check-in, to be fair was quite unprofessional. The staff were very nice but we had phoned and emailed the hotel 3 times in the week prior to travelling (and also at the time of booking) to specifically request a 5th floor room (furthest away from traffic noises) and we were assured that either a 4th or 5th floor room would be made available. Following check-in, we were handed a swipe-key for a room on the 2nd floor. Honest mistake, but when we discussed our previous correspondence regarding a 5th floor request, we were met with the usual shifting of shoulders, eyes to heaven and made to feel a little awkward. We were told a 5th floor room would not be ready until at least 3pm. Not a perfect start to our break. Not exactly living up to the big sign they have on their reception desk either claiming 4½ stars on Trip Advisor. The Suite: The first thing you notice on entry is the overwhelming smell of a disinfectant aerosol. I’m all for a nice smelling clean room – but not to the point of tasting the stuff on the back of my throat. If the room is cleaned properly, is there really a need for a spray? The room itself was a nice size, but in saying that – no great shakes and not overly comfortable. It may be a 4-star hotel, but in our opinion it’s more likely on the wrong end of that spectrum and much closer to a 3-star rather than pushing the boundaries for a 5-star commendation. It also suffers quite badly from noise pollution coming from adjacent rooms, be it other guests or just the cleaning staff each morning dragging furniture around. (Aside from the Conrad Maldives - you think that one hotel somewhere in the world would have resolved this problem by now by soundproofing the walls/ceilings? Bedroom: There was some mould on the ceiling/walls in the bedroom and although this was minimal – it’s still not something you should be subjected to in a 4-star hotel. In addition (and although we knew this before booking) not one single suite in the hotel comes with a double, queen or king size bed? All suites are twin (i.e. two single beds about a foot apart.) Not ideal when turning in the middle of the night and falling between the gap! Beds were a little hard and dead and resulted in quite a sore back each morning. Lounge area of the suite consisted of a plain 2-seater couch looking at a set of wardrobes – O, and a light. Lighting: If you need total darkness (to a reasonable extent) to go asleep, forget it. Yes, they provide black-out curtains, but that kind of defeats the purpose when there are (a) 2 x low light green LED lights flashing continuously in the ceiling at the end of your bed – with no way to turn them off and (b) 1 x emergency exit white light above the entry/exit door. This normally wouldn’t be a problem in a suite, but they have no doors to separate the lounge area and the bedroom, so the light streamed in. Not exactly a very bright light, but when your eyes adjust to the darkness, it feels like a lighthouse. We asked reception to check out the flashing LED’s only to be met with Manuel from Fawlty Towers – ‘no-speak-a-de-English’! Bathroom: The towels – I didn’t know you could fray towels so badly and still use them in a 4-star hotel? Completely unacceptable! No toilet roll on the 2nd day either? Unforgivable. The shower takes a while to get hot and magically, it still drips for 5 minutes even after you’ve turned it off? No usual notice in the bathroom either about changing towels by leaving them on the floor etc. so you can only assume it is the same policy as other hotels you may have frequented previously. Room service: What room service? The only hotel I have ever stayed in to date where there is no relevant information usually left on a table by the TV. No idea on the room service number to call, or the room service opening hours or available menus? I’ve stayed in 3-star hotels with much better room service. When we eventually got through, we were told we could have a selection of bread or a salmon bagel. Hmmmm, does that make you salivate or what? When we queried if they were our only options, we were told ‘yes’. Obviously we skipped. Air Con: Other reviews are also accurate with their description of the in-room AC. Can anyone tell me the point in having AC in a room (occupied and paid for by adults) when we’re treated like infants and not allowed to adjust it to our own individual needs? The room was like an oven (even in October) and with no AC we could only open the balcony doors and entertain the noise of street traffic for a few minutes. Internet: The free in-room internet is wired, but is fine. Forget about the Wi-Fi in the lobby area – it’s slower than old fashioned dial-up and keeps losing signal strength every few minutes (even when no one else was using the Wi-Fi.) Hotel in General: The location of the hotel is perfect in our opinion. Other reviews are accurate – it is about 7-10 minutes casual walk away from Plaza Catalunya – close enough to everything without the incessant traffic, noise, people, etc. If you prefer a more centrally located hotel on the doorstep of everything, then you’ll have to put up with a lot of noise and a lot of weird folk, beggars, homeless, pickpockets, etc. At night, the neighbourhood is fairly quiet and in a decent area – so no need to worry about weirdo’s following you. Breakfast: The breakfast is ok for €10 PP (even if the cereal choice is pathetic and the fruit is unripe) but the most annoying thing is that it appears to be perfectly ok for the hotel cleaning staff to pick from the buffet laid on for the hotel guests! They may not sit down in the same area, but they pick from it and on two mornings it resembled something like ‘feeding time at the Zoo’. Consequently, we were left with very little choice for our breakfast one morning. The staff also seem perfectly happy to stand at the buffet counter and shout, not talk to each other (like Spanish do) for 10-20 minutes at a time. Not exactly what you need first thing in the morning when a little groggy. It’s all just very unprofessional really. The catering staff also began to clear the buffet – even when hotel guests were still eating breakfast. I witnessed two hotel guests asking for items that were cleared away and my wife also had to ask where the croissants had suddenly gone? Sorry, that was the second most annoying thing. The most annoying thing without question is that the hotel shares the breakfast area with a café/restaurant next door – using a sliding door to divide the two. Aside from the huge noise pollution generated from next door, everyone smokes profusely, so 20 minutes after showering and getting dressed for breakfast, we now smelled like ash trays and had to shower and dress again – never mind breathing in passive smoke and the dangers associated with that! Completely and unbelievably unacceptable. My advice is to go somewhere else, or get to breakfast early so that you’re finished long before 10am. By the 2nd day we choose not to go back. Reception: Sit in the reception area for a few minutes in the morning and you can see cleaning staff and other staff ‘running’ around the floor at top speed. I’ve never seen anything like this in my life in any hotel I’ve stayed in. As my wife perfectly summed it up: “The hotel is not quite the worst ever, but none of the staff are professionally trained to any degree.” As you will know from other reviews, there is no swimming pool in the hotel, so definitely not a place to stay in the peak summer months or if you just like a swim in general. The roof-top bar appears to be a complete afterthought by management also. It was still open in October (surprise, surprise) but it is - without question the worst roof top bar I have ever witnessed in my life. There’s more ambience in a mortuary. Ironically, we knew (most of) what was in store for us when staying in this hotel – it’s just from writing this review that we suddenly realise what we were actually subjected to during our stay. Maybe it was the fact that we were literally using it for a hub to put our heads somewhere at night, or maybe it was the magic of Barcelona City that counteracted any negativity? The hotel is ideally located and very clean, but sadly that is really where the positivity ends. On this occasion, we were not interested in swimming or using a roof top bar, but room service would have been nice - especially when you’ve spent all day running around a huge and brilliant city and all you want to do is kick back and relax. Not having to share my breakfast with the hotel cleaning staff would also have been nice. Will we ever go back to Barcelona – absolutely, it’s the best short city break we’ve ever been on. Will we stay at Hotel Constanza when we go there – I think not!

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsaChrisD
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was new for me. I stayed in different hotels in Barcelona but, this was the best one so far. The hotel personal is helpfull and the rooms are clean and spacious. Even, the single room that I have was super. The hotel is very central and you are in 10 min. at the Plaza the Catalunya. I would recommended to any traveller. The breakfast is for 10 Euro a bargain for what you get. The following restaurant I would recommend in Barcelona Cuines Santa-Caterina !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Tonystarks81
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for 3 nights during our trip through Europe. The hotel was great. Lots of modern amenities, comfortable beds, great staff. The only flaw is the location, its a good 10 min walk to the Ramblas/Placa De Catalunya area. We were ok with this being we prefer hotels with modern amenities as opposed to older "charming/cozy" European hotels. The breakfast they offer was reasonable, the room had a balcony/terrace. Beware though, there is no WIFI in the rooms. Only a hardwired ethernet connection in the room. WiFi is only available in the Hotel Lobby. Was funny seeing everyone with their iPhones and iPads surfing the web on the couches in the lobby in the morning on their way out and in the evening. Also the rooftop bar was closed for the winter. Another small complaint, it was mid October when we stayed, the Room was incredibly hot at night. When we tried to turn on the AC and turn the thermostat down, it wouldn't work. Quick call to the front desk revealed that they override the HVAC system at night and turn on the heat for everyone. Otherwise this place was fantastic. I def recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: AFDK
Reviews.Content: Excellent service attitude: we arrived at 10 am, just wanting to drop off our luggage. The receptionist, extremely friendly to start with, immedeately set out to find us a room available. And what a room: superspacious, well designed and with our own balcony!

Reviews.Title: “More of a hostel than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of good reviews we choose this hotel for a 4 night stay and it was more of a nicely decorated hostel than a boutique hotel. It has no real services apaprt from a breakfast room - we did not partake as there are lots of good places nearby, oven and buenas miggas were good. The staff we found to be unfriendly and not especially helpful. our main issue was with our room (fantastic shower was the only positive) we asked for a double room when we booked in May and were given a twin room we had an uncomfortable first night and I requested a room change. I was told abruptly that the hotel was full and it wasn't possible on pushing the issue I was told to pack our things and they might be able to move us if other guests checking in that day didn't mind a twin room. As we felt this was unlikely and we didn't want to carry our valuables all day we declined and stayed in our uncomfortable and charmless room. The hotel is in a easy to get to area from the airport but if you are a discerning traveller and are looking for a boutique hotel as we were stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Deb1004
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room, great position, with friendly helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel in city centre area”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiTraveller20
Reviews.Content: Hotel Constanza, Barcelona. This is a nice modern, comfortable hotel situated in a quiet location, 3 streets from Plaza Catalunaya, (main city center) and within walking distance of about 10 minutes to the Plaza and metro station. We were a family of 3 and had a suite on a higher floor with a small balcony. The rooms were quite spacious with all the basic amenities and pretty much as shown on their website (which is not the case with other hotels). Free internet facility was available in the lobby lounge. The breakfast spread was ok and consisted of mainly cold cuts, breads, cheese, boiled tomatoes, juices and beverages. However the staff did offer to serve us hot omelets and fried eggs. The staff at the reception was very helpful and patiently replied to all our queries with a smile, special mention in this regard be made of Mr. Samuel. We would definitely recommend this hotel for tourists visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TonyMnUK
Reviews.Content: Besides having to deal with getting to the hotel after getting up from the Metro we really enjoyed the stay. The room was in the back of the property with a balcony facing other back gardens which was very quiet. The clerks were very helpful with directions and steered us to a very good restaurant for dinner. The room was very spacious, very comfortable bed and roomy bath. We didn't take part in the breakfast, we thought it would be more interesting to find our own on the streets. There are 2 roof top patio/bar areas that weren't operational when we were there, perhaps they're active during the summer. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BertOGouda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in Oct for a short holiday. I selected the hotel based on all the reviews at Tripadvisor and the price and the location. The hotel is very well placed, close to 2 metro stations and close to the Plaza Catalunya. There are good restaurants (for example Mussol) around the hotel. The room was very clean and modern with a nice balconie. The shower is beautiful. Only the couch bed could be better. We had no problems at all with the noise (like some other reviewers). It was all very quit. The staff are helpful and friendly. The breakfast is ok. Not very special, but if you take in consideartion that it is included in the room price (which is ok), then it is more than sufficient. You can also ask for scrambled eggs. The rooftop chillout zone is very nice, but beause it was already october it was only open from thursday untill sunday. The wetter was good, so it would have been nice if it was open more days. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location with friendly and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: carolgibson97
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location for exploring Barcelona,being quiet but close enough to attractions to walk to.Also very near to a metro station to make it easy to travel further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Calm & low-key but design-conscious boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: leklekblue
Reviews.Content: Loved the dark-chocolate brown design motif of the hotel—it starts in the nice long lobby and carries through every piece of the rooms (so you'd better like brown). You can read about the rooms pluses and minuses in other reviews (I don't like duvets—too hot—so that was a minus, although the sheets were super smooth and soft, a plus), so here are just a few extra thoughts. We ended up going for the in-hotel breakfast every day, just for ease of things. Fresh croissants, fruit, and the usual continental b'fast fare. We also ordered a fried egg every day, which went well with the ham and thick bread on offer. It was expensive though: US $12 per person. The rooftop bar was closed for the season, so we can't comment on that, except to say we went up there and while nice, there's no view from there, since you're on a side street and not that high up. We had a very nice meal at a restaurant called "Oven," down the block from the hotel on the corner of Bruc and Gran Via. Steak for one of us, tasty vegetable stir-fry for the other, a really good tiramisu dessert—it made a nice change-of-pace from tapas. The place was empty at 9 pm on a Tuesday evening. Convenient for rolling home, though. I couldn't have walked another step that day. Finally, when we went to check-out the last day, noticed a certificate from TripAdvisor.com proudly displayed on the front counter—the hotel had just gotten an award for being a good business hotel. I was happy for them—it was a nice boutique hotel experience in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DH1014
Reviews.Content: Sleek, contemporary designed hotel located 1 block north and 3 blocks east of Placa Catalunya. We took the Aero bus from the airport (5.05e/pp) and walked with our luggage from Placa Catalunya to the hotel. Staff was extremely helpful at all times, helping us navigate the city using the metro system. Restaurant next door (Con Calma) was so incredible for lunch that we ate there 3 times. Lunch included 4 different plates of food (preset menu by the chef and excellent each time) plus dessert and wine. Price varied from 12.95e-14.95e. Suite room comfortable with balcony facing a courtyard and very large shower with 2 different shower heads. Rooftop area to sit and I believe drinks are served there on the weekends. Supermarket right around the corner as well as cafes and a couple of metro stations. Easy to walk everywhere. Very quiet area compared to the crowds located just 3 blocks away. It was perfect for our needs. I see in another review that the price was 120e for the suite. We paid 140e, don't know why it was more. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 2 star Boutique hotel close to Paseo de Gracias with 4 star Deco”
Reviews.Author: pschubert
Reviews.Content: Hotel very clean, people very helpfull and friendly. Good breakfast and good advice for restaurants nearby the hotel. Very clean rooms, a must go when in Barcelona, because you reach mayor attraction by foot: Paseo de Gracia, Ramblas, Plaza Catalunya, Casa Batllo, etc... Better than some four star hotels I have tried.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant find!”
Reviews.Author: noxioust
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in Oct whilst attending a conference at CCIB. After having spent hours on the internet researching hotels in BCN, I decided on the Constanza. What a find! It's very well placed, close to 2 metro stations, close to the Plaza Catalunya, and yet away from the busy streets. There are good restaurants and shopping around the hotel. The rooms are very clean, modern with balconies. There's free cable internet. The shower is amazing! The only problem I had like some of the reviewers, was the loud noise from people dragging their chairs across the floor. The doors do not slam unlike some other hotels I have been in. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. I have found that whenever I needed assistance at the front desk, there would only be one member of staff, which occasionally equals a waiting period of 5 to 10 minutes. The breakfast is ok. The rooftop chillout zone is cool but the bar is located on the ground floor. Not sure if we were supposed to get drinks at the bar and bring it to the rooftop? Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and centrally located, but rude service.”
Reviews.Author: werldtravuler
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, bed was very comfortable, bathroom nice and spacious. We didn't find the hotel to be especially noteworthy as described by other reviewers. It was just your run of the mill $120/night hotel. One thing we did not appreciate however was the rude service we received during check-in. The woman behind the counter didn't get off the phone with any sense of urgency and we ended up waiting a bit. When she did get off the phone she was very short with us, no "welcome to the hotel" or even a smile. When we asked to store our bags while our room was being cleaned she acted like we were putting her out. Instead of lifting our bags into the closet herself she made us do it. The man checking us out the next morning was much friendlier and helpful, but the first experience gave us a sour impression of the hotel. There was also a problem with the free internet access in the lobby which made it very difficult to check in to our flights leaving the next day All in all the hotel is fine, but I'm not racing to get back there.

Reviews.Title: “Believe all the positive reviews they are right on!”
Reviews.Author: jane155043
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel. Staff was so friendly. Decorated so funky and yet comfortable. I am really picky on clean and this hotel is so clean. Staff was very helpful with all our questions of Barcelona which I am sure they have answered a million times. But still with a smile. They always greeted us when we entered the hotel. The location is good - close but off the busy streets. We felt we received more than value for the price of the hotel room. If you haven't been to Barcelona - I highly recommend it. A beautiful fun city. But come hungry because the food is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, nice, nice, great spot, great staff!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EJP49
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel located close to all the action. Within walking distance to all the major sites, but quietly hidden out of all the hustle and bustle. Our room was ready for an early check-in, staff went out of their way to be helpful. Cleaning staff slipped in and out without bothering us. A nice, safe and relaxing place to stay in heart of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with modern designed rooms and a cozy rooftop bar/lounge”
Reviews.Author: Seanito
Reviews.Content: We could not have been more happy with this hotel during our stay. The rooms were exceptionally designed--beautiful tile floors throughout the room, an extremely comfortable platform bed and pillows, and best of all--an amazing stall shower with a large shower head (hard to find a shower like this in much of Europe!). The front desk staff was cordial and often helpful throughout our stay. The lounge downstairs was very inviting with several leather sectional couches and muted lighting. There was a nice cafe next door with great coffee and fresh squeezed OJ. The clincher for us was the rooftop lounge which we were surprised to find few people using through the week. The lounge turned into a bar on Fri & Sat nights offering Mojitos and other cocktails. There was also free WiFi service up here. This hotel was just what we needed for the first week of our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: clivem_10
Reviews.Content: A smart and comfortable small hotel, nicely furnsihed with a balcony which in our case looked out onto the backs of adjacent properties but was still a pleasant place to sit. The price seemed competitive and the hotel was located just two or three blocks away from the Playa Catalunya served by the airport bus. Several nice restaurants and a handy supermarket all within a few minutes walk. Most of the major tourist attractions were reachable on foot, although Parc Guell and the Waterfront merited a Metro ride. The hotel was handy for Metro stations. (Watch out for pickpockets on the Metro, in particular if the escalotor stops suddenly - we had a narrow escape) Great for a city break in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful room, warm service”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerABQ
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just a short walk away from Las Ramblas, close enough to walk but far enough away to enjoy a quiet night's sleep. The staff was extremely pleasent and helpful, the room was elegant, spaceous and included a patio and the location was perfect (for us) The internet services was fast and reliable which was a real plus. We did not try breakfast as we found plenty of choices nearby (hotel is very close to Grand Avenue).

Reviews.Title: “A delightful surprise”
Reviews.Author: ChinaFanNYC
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Barcelona this year, and the Meridien Hotel on La Rambla (where I had stayed in June was completely full. Thanks to Tripadvisor, I found the Constanza and it was superlative in all respects. It is on a quiet, shady street quite close to the hubbub of Catalunya Square and the major sights of the Eixample. The welcome from Reda at reception was warm and informative; in fact all the staff were expert. The suites I had booked (two of them) were attractive and roomy (they even had small balconies) and at 120 Euros each were a great deal. All four of us felt the same way: we would return here in a nanosecond.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate room in great location.”
Reviews.Author: omullens21
Reviews.Content: Location. Location. Location. Rooms were suffiicient, beds were a little less. Roof top bar is scenic but expensive. Ease of access to metro, las ramblas and gothic quarter are unbeatable. Staff was helpfull and polite. WiFi only worked in the lobby and the business center printer did not work.

Reviews.Title: “nice and warm boutique hotel near the center”
Reviews.Author: NoTaxis
Reviews.Content: nice atmosphere in this modern but warm boutique hotel. staff speak a good english and they are really efficient. the breakfast is a basic buffet, but not too bad if you are too lazy to go outside.... didn't try the restaurant and didn't have a chance to try the rooftop bar, it was closed... but you can still access to the rooftop. the location of the hotel is really central and you don't need to use the transportation... our room was very quiet, with a nice balcony (not a tiny one). but for all suites they just have twins bed, when you expect a king size... on this point a bit disappointed, also we had a leaking in the bathroom but was fixed immediately. and needed to change the bath towel as well. but it was efficient. last small detail, couldn't find any english TV channel.... all the rest was perfect. if i need to go back in this hotel i will.....definitely.....!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A really fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sinbar
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. The rooms are extremely clean and spacious. The bathroom was outstanding. The staff were so helpful and very friendly, they made sure to smile and say hello every time we went in or out. I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends and family and if we go back to Barcelona I will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 star hotel at good price - not too far from Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Ravs24
Reviews.Content: This is a good 4 star hotel - very chic and modern. Located approximately .5 mile from Las Ramblas, around a 5-7 min walk. The hotel staff is really very helpful with what to see, when to see it, which places to eat at - their recommendations were spot on. Loved the room - very contemprary with comfortable beds and pillows. The room had a decent sized balcony, so you can sit out and drink tea/wine etc. The bathroom was nice and spacious - they also provide good toiletries, hair dryer, etc. The room had a wired internet connection, nice flat screen TVS, mini fridge and a safe.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best relation price/quality!”
Reviews.Author: GioBee
Reviews.Content: I loved the room, huge, quite and looking the street. Quick to go to the centre -Portal del Angel just few streets away. The reception is quite nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: emga
Reviews.Content: The good things were clean and nice rooms, great location close to placa catanluna but not noisy outside, free computer use and wifi. It was though sounds from the corridor, where you could hear other people talk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great deal.”
Reviews.Author: gwasshoppah
Reviews.Content: As usual, the description seemed too good to be true for the price, so I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby & rooms are very new & comfortable, including upscale modern "deco" bathrooms and flat-screen TVs. The only negative point was that the room view was into an ordinary residential courtyard - although it did have the advantage of being quiet & calm. Although they offered a rather expensive breakfast buffet, there was a nice café next door where you could get a morning's 'café con leche' & breakfast sandwich for 4€. The hotel is rather centrally located as well, although not on top of the subway station you can still walk into the center. Finally, the price was a bargain at less than 100€ a night. All and all, worth coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for us.”
Reviews.Author: 123frenchwine
Reviews.Content: The Constanza was recommended to us by friends who said it was the best hotel they stayed in during a long vacation in Europe. I can see why. Throughout our stay, the staff were amazing helpful and friendly. The persons working the desk all spoke excellent English and, even more importantly, always were eager to help us with directions and bookings at sights and other hotels. They helped me find the Bus Station as the best and cheapest place to park our car. About 16 euros per day. The location of the hotel is wonderful. It is not in the noisy part of the old town but it within an easy walk of the sights there. It is also not far out in the outskirts of the city. There is a taxi stand right on the corner if you want to go a bit further. There is steady traffic on the street, but the double-glazed windows made our room, which was on the street, perfectly quiet. The staff who made up our room were charming and, even with our very limited Spanish, we could communicate easily. The room was very comfortable, with good modern beds. The bath was up to a high standard as well. The elevator worked well. We had the breakfast each morning, which became a perfect chance to meet with our friends and talk about our day At 10 euros per person, it was a bargain. The hotel is decorated in a clean modern style, which we appreciated. The restaurant next to the lobby has excellent food and is an incredible bargain. We payed 13 euros for a three-course lunch that was first class. When we go back to Barcelona, we will absolutely stay at the Constanza. It has our highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Hotel, Just don't go in AUG”
Reviews.Author: japrilbakke
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and great staff, very clean, a "nice hotel" that costs only about 100 Eur; Request a room w/ a terrace, has a mini bar great beds, showers, etc. Would stay again for sure as long as its not aug. Aug in Eixample neighborhood is a ghost town, nothing is open so we ended up takin the metro to the gothic quarter anyway, not real far or a big deal but if going in aug stay in the gothic quarter instead.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, very modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: blessed16
Reviews.Content: Location: Out of the touristy trap but walking distance to everything touristy. Had breakfast at a local coffee shop, the best and least expensive I had while traveling throughout Spain. It was about a 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya. Close to bus stop and metros. Hotel: Our room was very, very, clean. The rooms were very modern looking and big. Our room had a balcony and an additional seating area with sofa. The bathroom was pristine and the shower was fantastic. There were two complimentary computers with printers and wi-fi for use. I loved staying at Constanza. Our room had a balcony with great furniture, but the hotel has a very nice roof top terrace to just sit and unwind.

Reviews.Title: “I went away for a girls weekend and the...”
Reviews.Author: Lucyhames
Reviews.Content: I went away for a girls weekend and the hotel was everything we expected. The hotel is modern, the staff was very welcoming, our room was spacious (suite) and only a short walk from the city centre!

Reviews.Title: “A few minor changes would make this hotel much better -”
Reviews.Author: notmuchtime
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, blocks from many sites. Modern, clean decor. Rooms were fine - stayed in a single room, which was small but fine. As others have said, noise is an issue - marble floors throughout, so slamming of doors echoes. Had a group of younger males staying in hotel, and I had to call three times about the yelling down the hallways, yelling out the windows,etc. No phone messages can go to phones in rooms - have to check at desk for messages - wish I would have known! Daytime staff very helpful - night staff gruff and looked pained at every request. Also, rooftop terrace, which is one of the reasons I booked here, is only open Th - Sat nights as a lounge. Can't access during the day. Single rooms have no terraces of their own, so I was out of luck. Terrace could remain open for sunning, reading, etc. during the day. Fitness center is two blocks away, but a beautiful facility - 10euros per visit - so it gets pricey. Overall, the location here wins out, as it is perfect, but again, a few minor changes and this hotel could be wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Eron03SanDiego
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are large, the showers are bigger than you find in the States, the staff is very helpful; the price is right, and the location is perfect. There is another hotel with a very similar name (NH Constanza) so be sure that the taxi driver knows which hotel you want or you will be driven all over Barcelona and then have to do it all over again to get to the right hotel. It is an easy 10 minute walk (give or take) to the Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in great location, close to everything, really friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kristy_housley
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, well fitted rooms with fantastic rain shower. Awesome location less than 10 mins walk from Plaza Catalunya. Really friendly and helpful staff, even gave tips as to trains to catch to our next destination in Sitges and looked up departure times for us. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Superb location in BCN”
Reviews.Author: Perzsa
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a superb location, the Pl. Catalunya is in walking distance and you can find nearly every transportation line there. The room was clean and silent, we had a balcony there, which wasn't too big (you cannot sit there on a chair). There were free internet (only cabel) in the room and wifi in the lobby (and two PC, free of charge). The only negative thing is the size of the bed. Anyway, quality for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona's BEST!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tina188669
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great. We booked a double room and got a suite... it was nicely decorated, big, loungy, a great big terras, awesome shower: walk in rain shower the staff was nice, they speak fluent english in the lobby there are 2 computers with free internet lots of brochures on what to do in Barcelona nice breakfast; great coffee! we alo had lunch at the hotel: we paid 28euro for a 5 course menu for two people: a tomato and mozarella salad, a wok dish with shrimp, steak with a nice sauce and patato mash, fish with spinach, crema catalana and coffee the hotel has a nice location, very close to the ramblas etc.... just great!! we loved the hotel and would book this again

Reviews.Title: “The location was great and the room was perfect in size and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: jesseauth
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was great and was an ideal way to start our days navigating this amazing city. Use of the computers was a nice bonus to stay in touch with our families in the united states. It was an amazing place to relax and make our plans for touring the city during the day. The one thing to detract was that we had a hard time figuring out the room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: LawLaw88
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Our room was fantastic - modern; very tastefully decorated; great shower - and we enjoyed sitting out on our balcony. Although some have mentioned that the rooms were not very soundproof, we didn't have any problems sleeping, and the only noise we heard very occasionally was movement of the heavy chairs that seem to be provided in every room. The hotel was also much closer to the centre of Barcelona than we had originally expected, which was a pleasant surprise. The only downsides were the lack of tea/coffee-making facilities in the room, and I would also liked to have had breakfast at the hotel, but it was far too expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: dan_lemos
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fantastic because the hotel is well located, modern funished with excelent facilities, very clean, helpful and kind staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Hotel Constanza”
Reviews.Author: hols006
Reviews.Content: Perfect location,everything very near while street itself is nice and quiet. Excellent spacey and luxury room with very good airco, while we also had a very nice balcony. Very friendly and efficient staff. Barcelona also great, so chances are we will be going back there and will certainly try to stay again in Hotel Constanza

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: FABREE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in the suite (114). Spacious and contemporary decor Kelly Hoppen style but not at (The Murmuri price!) wth sleek furnishing, flat screen TV and the biggest private terrace in the hotel! A plus if u like sun lounging but being on the first floor everyone could see u. The lounge is pleasantly welcome,felt like u ve entered into Armani Casa show room. The staffs are genuinely friendly and accomodating. Room is aptly sapcious for a suite wth a separate sitting area opening into private terrace. I would recommend suites from third floor onwards which have a better layout as shown kindly by the staff. The bed is not the most comfy though. It would be perfect if the beddings were from fine egyptian cotton. Bathroom is modern and wth Hans Grohe fitting and those wth shower comes wth a big spacious plush cubicle. There is free internet and for fitness fanatic Holmes place is around the corner for 15 euro per entry. I have recommended to the hotel for the guests to have free pass like other hotels around the areas do. The street is not as plush as Paseo De Gracia or but quiet and safe and within alking distance to Plaza Catalunya. Overall a very pleasant stay at a very reasonable price for Barcelona and I am indeed coming again in few weeks for another stay this time at Suite 502 which is a top floor delight. Got my great deal thru booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good soundproofing but very good location and even beter customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mikko_78
Reviews.Content: Service were excelent. Rooms were very nice and well equipped but a little bit noisy. You could hear every word to your room that has spoken in the hallway. The breakfest was little too sweet for the scandinavian taste but that's a minor thing. Location was perfect for the first timer Barcelona turist because of the short walk to Placa Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: jbchocolate
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before our cruise and then one night at the end of the cruise. Both days we were able to get into our room early, one day to sleep (very quiet) and the other day to sightsee in the city. Rooms were clean with balconies and had very modern fixtures. It was a 3 block walk to the metro and close to Las Ramblas. The staff was very helpful with directions. Excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: missemmarobertson
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideal for our stay. Really nicely and modernly decorated. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the location was perfect for us. I have marked the sleep quality lower because on 2 of the 4 nights we spent here we had very noisy neighbours who woke us up in the middle of the night. Not the hotel's fault, but I don't think the walls are very thick, so if you're a light sleeper take ear plugs!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: katgreen
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, room a bit on the small side. We had an interior courtyard terrace (room 508) which helped to brighten the room and make it seem a bit larger. The bathroom was fantastic with a huge walk in shower and a big "rain shower" shower head. The location is superb -- just a short walk to the Placa Catalunya and about a 10-15 walk to the trendy El Born area. You are guaranteed a quiet night's sleep by staying just outside of the tourist fray. Wifi in the lobby was the slowest every and the computers were usually in use. If you depend on an internet connection, I would not recommend this hotel. Staff was fine when we had questions, but didn't offer any information above what was asked. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT AT THE HOTEL CONSTANZA!”
Reviews.Author: James66667
Reviews.Content: We Loved the hotel. It is located on a quiet street a short walk from the heart of the city! Comfortable, well designed rooms with a great bathroom and shower. A very helpful gracious staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Modern, Efficient - Like a Mini 'W'”
Reviews.Author: sandk06
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed two nights at the hotel Constanza which is in a great area of Barcelona. It's just 5 blocks of La Rambla in a nice area of the city: La Eixample. There are restaurants, cafes, and tourist sites nearby - many within walking distance. The single and double rooms are small, even by European standards, but well laid out to take advantage of all available space. The staff is generally good. There are some who are much better than others. The woman who greeted us and checked us in was very helpful and gave us solid advice, whereas the gentleman in the evening was nice, but not very helpful. For the combination of price and location, this is a great find, but only if you plan to do a lot of touring and spend little time in your room. If you're looking for a luxury spot, this isn't it, but if you're looking for a solid value with a nice design and comfortable bed, you've found your match.

Reviews.Title: “great helpful staff in a well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: pacifictina
Reviews.Content: very personal and professional staff who answered my many questions. hotel was clean and quiet and near the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: 2815riggs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a 4 day visit in June 2010 and would highly recommend it. The location could not be better, for our purposes: it was a 10 minute walk to Pl. Catalunya, where the Aerobus to/from the airport stops, 10 min to La Rambla, 5 min to the subway, 15 min to La Boqueria, and 15 min to Eixample. It's not right next to Pl Catalunya so it's very quiet, on a small tree lined street. There are several stores close by to buy water, bread, fruit and other necessities. The room was nicely decorated and clean. Our favorite feature was the nice big balcony. Service was professional, I wouldn't call it friendly, but we got all our questions answered. WiFi in the lobby only, but not usable. Internet access from lobby PCs are sloooow. Overall, we had a great stay and would come back to Constanza again.

Reviews.Title: “modern clean hotel in good location..great value...”
Reviews.Author: charleybrownuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a pre cruise stay for a night in Barcelona...only 10min walk from Placa Catalunya...or very short walk to underground only one stop away from placa Catalunya for connecting lines. Great drench shower and room with a balcony and air conditioning...flatscreen TV and contemporary bedding My husband and I (early 30s) couldn't fault this hotel...would be great for couple of any age as hotel was modern but not too 'over the top' funky

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay until I discovered bed bug bites on face and neck.”
Reviews.Author: JaneTravelsEurope
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, the location was very convenient, and the staff was very helpful. Hallways were rather dark. However, it appears that they are experiencing a problem that has become fairly common these days---bed bugs. My assumption is that the pillow I used was infested because the 17 bites I experienced were on my face and neck. I realize this is a difficult problem to eradicate but urge the hotel to address it immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Smart boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: OwlheadLondon
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, central location, smart modern interior. Good value. We've already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: eanewlywed
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel within walking distance to many of Barcelona's best tourist spots. Very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Annemm
Reviews.Content: Very quiet hotel, which we really liked. Probably because it was a 10/15 mins walk to city centre, it would have been nice if it was closer. We had a suite that was very spacious with a nice sized balcony (and sun in the late afternoon! nice!). Very good shower and simple but nice design of the room. In the lobby there is free WI-FI but in the rooms you have to connect through a wire. We did not have breakfast included and therefore did not visit the restaurant. Enough places around to have breakfast though.

Reviews.Title: “A modern hotel with great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Senecadee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was as nice as the photos on its website. We requested a quiet room on the back away from the street and we had a nice balcony overlooking several courtyards. The hotel clerks were very friendly and helpful. The location was very good - close to Plaza Catalunya and the subway. There were restaurants in walking distance. We did not try the hotel's breakfast buffet because of the bad reviews on Trip Advisor. If they could improve that, it would be a plus.

Reviews.Title: “loved our stay at Constanza”
Reviews.Author: kddToronto
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Constanze - excellent location, kind and helpful staff, clean room with a lovely balcony (the room at the back has the larger private balcony), quiet, free internet and 2 computers in the lobby for free use. The price is excellent and no need to pay for the breakfast as there are plenty of places to grab a cafe and pastry nearby.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CHOICE, EXCELLENT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: EvJer17
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a two-night stay in advance of a cruise in celebration of our 50th wedding anniversary. We had booked the hotel on the Internet and it was everything we had hoped for -- and more. Modern, boutique hotel, clean and comfortable room with a sweet little balcony facing the street, convenient and quiet location, and a friendly and helpful staff. Leandro, at the front desk, was exceptionally accommodating and patient in helping us resolve an unexpected personal situation that had developed. Free Internet access was a plus. The only negative was that the bath/shower should have grab bars for seniors such as us who need something to hold on to. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great location, staff could be more helpful”
Reviews.Author: fm27
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find and was a 10 minute walk from Barcelona North bus station, where we had got the Ryanair bus to from Girona airport. The location was ideal - in a quiet leafy suburb nearby plenty of cash machines, restaurants, a supermarket and a chemist and about 10-15 minutes walk from the central shopping/tourist area. Staff spoke reasonable English, but did not explain at check-in what time we should check out, where and what times breakfast was available and we had to ask about the spa/fitness facilities, which turned out to be provided elsewhere. However, we were able to check in early at 10am as our room was available. We had a suite with twin beds, double sofa bed, large bathroom with luxury shower (no bath though) and our own balcony. The suite was decorated in a modern luxurious style with a desk, large mirrors, large flat screen TV, wardrobe space and hangars, a free digital safety deposit box and a refrigerated minibar. The beds and bedding were clean and very comfortable, we were in room 407 facing out the back of the hotel and had no problems with noise. However, i got a fright when there was a huge cockroach by the sink in the bathroom when I went to the loo in the night (don't leave the window open like I did!!), but I am assured this is normal for hot countries. Breakfast was ok, not a huge selection of items but you could help yourself to bread, cheese, cold meats, pastries, croissants, cereal, fruit, yogurt, tea and coffee. Guests are left to make their own hot drinks and toast at the breakfast station, I would have expected at least these to have been served to us at the price we paid but hey ho. Overall, a very stylish, clean, comfortable hotel that is let down a little by the small touches such as staff explaining the facilities when you check in and serving tea and coffee at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ivigata
Reviews.Content: The service was efficient the room big and clean. Barcelona is always a beautiful city The best catalan people and food

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: travel8cher
Reviews.Content: Honestly, the hotel is perfect on all counts but one. The location is ideal - nice leafy great block away from the tourist traffic, staff is very attentive, lots of great restaurants nearby, best shops down the street, and train station and metro just blocks away. But the place is constructed out of cardboard. Not a problem if you are a heavy sleeper, but unfortunately I am not. I stayed for 8 nights and I have to stay a few were quite restless as noise from other rooms and hallway were very disturbing. However, other than that...perfect.

Reviews.Title: “nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Remenos
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 4 days and didn't have enough time to spent in the hotel as I wanted to be all over the city (good location by the way, metro station is 2 blocks away). I really enjoyed the room (suite) as it was in a reasonable price and well decorated. The hotel offers a very helpful guide of Barcelona that you find in the room and a lot of information you can also find in the lobby (free internet) and the staff in the reception is very helpful. The bathroom is great (I enjoyed the shower) and all inside the room look like new. The only problem is that the walls are too thin and in the quiet hours you can still listen disturbing sounds from the other rooms and the hall that may not let you enjoy your sleep. Also, for 10e i think the breakfast could be richer.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel service, comfort, and location were wonderful but it was noisy.”
Reviews.Author: perlagold
Reviews.Content: The suite we were in was extremely clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. We were within walking distance of most of the sites we wanted to see, which was great. The only criticism I could find was that the walls were thin and it was very noisy, which disrupted our sleep several nights during our 5 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet, friendly & helpful staff, nice room with balcony”
Reviews.Author: ACMOakdale
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the end of a cruise. The staff was very helpful, letting us leave our luggage there & giving us directions with a map. Our room was a good size with a balcony. We often asked the staff for direction & they were always very accommodating. The location is very quiet & not far to walk to Los Rambles. Metro station very close. They recommended a tapas bar that was excellent. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Content with Constanza”
Reviews.Author: jogee9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly nestled in a quiet neighborhood nearby Placa de Cataluna. This hotel is an amazing value so look no further for a place to stay. Tourist sites are within walking distance. Samuel was very helpful at check-in & advised us about the best rooms available. We decided to upgrade our room for 10 euros additional to a larger room (#407) facing the back. The room had a nice sitting area & french doors onto a bright balcony with comfortable furniture. Tania was great for advice on directions & train station information. The breakfast (included) was absolutely great & overseen by an attentive staff. Two internet stations are always available in a corner of the lobby. I would absolutely return here & highly recommend it to anyone looking for a romantic getaway in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic contemporary style hotel, great service in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: SLa46
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful, offering great advice. We had a suite which was spacious with high quality furnishings and lovely bathroom. We loved the contemporary feel of the room and the calm, quiet and beautiful reception area. The hotel is in a really good location - close enough to walk to the gothic area, La Rambla etc. and to local stops to catch metros/buses but in a quieter leafy part of the city than many other hotels we saw.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: ABERStockholm
Reviews.Content: Great location and a really nice designed hotel. Room was spacious and practically organised. The bed was quite hard and not so big (for 2 persons), room was also quite noisy. I also missed a chair or something to sit on on the balcony. Besides that it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: PaulBaileyPBAUK
Reviews.Content: Spent only one night at Hotel Constanza before joining a short cruise. Our suite was very clean, with good modern furniture and a very comfortable bed. Good position - we were able to walk back to the hotel from the Cinc Sentis Restaurant (highly recommended incidentally). Only one adverse comment - which is nothing to do with the hotel. our taxi driver tried to take us to another Hotel Constanza way out of town. Ensure they know it is on C. Bruc!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SweetPeaSanDiego
Reviews.Content: This hotel was on a nice quiet street in the Exiample but was close enough to the Ramblas that you can walk. The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean. I would say this hotel resembles a W Hotel in the way it was furnished. The breakfast the hotel provided was good and came with the price of the room. There is a great restaurant on the same street as the hotel called New Oven.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: RandomGirl
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty stylish place! Very nice for the price. Our room was larger than I expected it would be (based on other rooms I have stayed in in Spain and Italy). The staff was very friendly and helpful. I did have jetlag when I was there, so I did hear some noises from the hall in the early morning hours, but I didn't generally have a problem with noise, as some other reviewers have mentioned. It's really nice.... stay there!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAFF, FRESHLY REFURBISHED, REASONABLY PRICED”
