Reviews.Author: Katherine2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Constanza from 6 to 9 May, 2 days more than planned since our plane was grounded due to volcanic ash. We were impressed from the start with the beautiful decor (just like the pictures!) the modern fittings, and freshly refurbished rooms. The decor was ultra modern and very attractive. We intended staying 2 nights only, however as our flight out was cancelled due to volcanic ash, we rang from the airport to see if we could get another night at short notice. We could, and they even agreed to the same rate that we had booked the first time at 150 euros per night. As it turned out we needed to stay a 4th night and got the same rate again. The reception staff could not have been more helpful, and even saved me when I found my mobile phone charger did not work, and gave me one that worked for no charge. Cannot speak highly enough about the staff, who were unendingly helpful and friendly. The hotel is far enough away from the Ramblas (10 minute walk) to be quiet and peaceful, but close enough to walk easily. Full buffet breakfest was a reasonable 10 euros each. Our room had a large balcony overlooking a huge inner courtyard, so no street noise. LCD TV with CNN and BBC news for the English speakers. Strangely no clock anywhere in the room. Rooms very comfortably appointed, as new furnishings and fittings. Free internet (2 computers and a printer provided) in the lobby, free wifi in the lobby also. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a comfortable reasonably priced stay in Barcelona, in a friendly modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Hotel Constanza”
Reviews.Author: Travel4ever74
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Constanza in Barcelona. I was accompanied by my daughter and her husband. We stayed in a suite that comfortably accomodated 3 people. The hotel lobby and our suite was very clean and modern. The location of Hotel Constanza is excellent. It is in a beautiful area of Barcelona that is adjacent to the tourist sites but is far enough away as to not be affected by street noise. We found it easy to walk to almost all tourist areas. Hotel Constanza is within easy walking distance to the Barcelona metro if needed. The metro covers all area of Barcelona. The metro is clean and safe. The staff at Hotel Constanza were very friendly and helpful. Since my Spanish is a little rusty, I found the fact that they they all spoke English to be an advantage at times. I definitely would recommend that travelers not stay anywhere near La Rambla because the area is too congested and noisy 24 hrs per day. Hotel Constanza is a much better option. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the finest hotels I stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Fijnzinnig
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for five days and this is truly a very nice hotel. We had a room at the back. We liked the design, it was large, it had comfortable beds and most important: it was perfectly calm. The bathroom was convenient with a spacious walk-in shower. Free internet, a safe. We were very pleased with this hotel and Eixample is a great area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, comfortable, clean and well presented”
Reviews.Author: Manc_Dwarf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when visiting Barcelona for the F1. The hotel's staff are very welcoming and check in was very efficient. The lobby is a pleasant place to spend time and there is plenty of room to relax on one of the large sofas or surf the internet on one of the PCs - valuable when trying to figure out contingency plans for the ash cloud! We all had single rooms. While these are a little small, they are very well presented and furnished with big TVs and nice bathrooms. Showers were small but nice and powerful. The only issue we had was that the sounds from the corridor can really carry through into the rooms - annoying when its late at night or early in the morning. I would definitely stay here again and would certainly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent design hotel!”
Reviews.Author: billetdetrain
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my short stay in this very nice and very well decorated hotel. Loved it all - the room (junior suite), the big balcony, the calm (room facing courtyard), the linen and matress (very confortable)and the discreet but helpful staff at the front desk. It is exactly as beautiful as in the photos on the website! The hotel is very centrally located (yet not in a noisy area), near restaurants and coffeshops, and very convenient for getting to the airport etc, takes about 5-10 minutes to walk to the Placa de Catalunya from where the airport bus leaves. A perfect place to stay when visiting Barcelona, whether it's for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, great location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ilikegoingaway
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for my mother in law's 80th birthday celebration weekend and it exceeded our expectations by a mile. It's in a quiet and safe neighbourhood, but only 10 minutes from Placa Catalunya at the top of La Rambla where you can pick up the tourist buses and the bus from the airport, it's a 5 euro taxi ride from there if walking is a problem. We were able to check in really early into 4/5 rooms. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, including our lovely cleaner. The rooms are fab, massive showers, cool decor, a safe and a balcony. There's a lift which is v handy.Our room was on the 'main' road but wasn't at all noisy. Take a cat5 cable if you want to use your computer in the room, although there's internet tin the lobby with a printer. If you get a room at the back of the hotel, your balcony has some wicker chairs to enjoy the afternoon sun, the 1st floor rooms appear to have a patio. There's also a rooftop terrace which we didn't take advantage of on this occasion. Our teenagers were out late one evening and they had no problem accessing the hotel at some ungodly hour! We didn't try the breakfast but the breakfast room looked OK, there are 2 cafes on the same block which do coffee and crosissant for 2 euros (not open Sundays) There are plenty of restaurants within a 5-10 min walk including one, Barkeno we all went to for the birthday celebration - separate review. All in all a great hotel, would thoroughly recommend it to anyone travelling to Barcelona and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especialy the location.”
Reviews.Author: LeoBessa
Reviews.Content: It was a good stay. the only bad thing thats the internet, because does not work in the room, but only in the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Gem”
Reviews.Author: JHL_2010
Reviews.Content: In the bustling city of Barcelona it was wonderful to be relax in our very comfortable and quiet room only 3 blocks from Placa Catalunya. Beautifully decorated, lovely bathroom and shower, safe, internet access in room and comfy bed. The breakfast was quite expensive and not very exciting but there were plenty of restaurants / cafes close by.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend Hotel Constanza to anyone going to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Loves-2-travel-123
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for a a work trip and decided to extend our stay for a holiday. This means that we switched hotels half way through our trip. The first hotel was on La Rambla and was very busy, noisy, small and expensive. The Hotel Constanza was like a breath of fresh air! We loved our stay there and have already recommended it to anyone going to Barcelona. The rooms were quiet, clean, spacious and modern. There is internet access in the room, a FANTASTIC shower and a lovely terrace where we could relax after a busy day. Only complaint was our in room safe never worked, despite many a phone calls to the front desk. In the big scheme of things we loved the hotel and the neighborhood it was in!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manxman45
Reviews.Content: Quiet, comfortable, well managed and reasonably priced for this city. Will certainly stay here on our next trip to marvelous Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Refusal of refund during volcanic eruption and didn't accomodate us this weekend either”
Reviews.Author: AceyNi
Reviews.Content: Booked and pre-paid to go to this hotel 2 weeks ago but were prevented from going due to volcanic eruption. Hotel refused to refund our money but most likely were able to re- book our room to many stranded tourists, at inflated prices, probably loosin nothing. ironically they did not have any room avaible this weekend when we were able to reschedule our flight at no additional charge. The funny thing is I just got this e-mail asking to write a review about our stay!!!!! Well, not having stayed there I am unable to make comment (hence the ratings) but based on their dealing with this situation I would be very hesitant about booking and paying up front in future. Maybe the management would come back with an offer of accomodation at a later date for usand hopefully raise our opinion. Bookings.com did not help at all in the situation telling us it was between us and the hotel - washed their hands completely.!! However Barcelona is a beautiful city and we will definately be back to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding recommendation”
Reviews.Author: pearsoninmarin
Reviews.Content: A friend who lives in Barcelona highly recommended Hotel Costanza and it lived up to its outstanding reputation. Comfortable, attractive rooms, friendly and efficient staff, and a great location. We will definitely return on our next trip to Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mishaSt.Paul
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, and close enough to most of the main attractrions in the old gothic quarter that you can walk there. 15-20 minute walk. The TV in our room did not work, and no technicians were on duty over the weekend so the clerk upgraded us to a larger room with a functioning TV. A lovely hotel on a residential street far enough away from tourist noise that you can sleep.

Reviews.Title: “It was really great!!!”
Reviews.Author: IreneSav
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in April. It was our first time that we ordred everything over Internet. We were very afraid not to get wat was shown and written. But it was great! The location is brilliant: you're in the heart of the city, but still on the quiet street. It took us 5-7 minutes to get to Placa de Catalunia and to Passeig de Gracia. The staff was efficient and pleasant. The rooms were clean and newly refurbished. We also spent time on the nice terrace of the hotel. All in all, it was great and beautiful! We recommended this hotel to our friends and relatives!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super clean, beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Cle_stranger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Constanza for 6 nights in April. Absolutely loved it. My two main criterias are location and cleanliness, and on both Constanza skores the highest mark. In addition, the bed was comfortable, the room spacious and nicely decorated as you can see from the pictures, and having a balcony was a definite plus. Computers with internet connection (though bit slow) in a lobby was another plus. The only area of possible improvement would be a better light in the bathroom (noted by my husband when shaving). Would definitely recommended the place to anyone, young or old ;-)

Reviews.Title: “excellent. employees so nice”
Reviews.Author: yarphil
Reviews.Content: excellent except this bloody emergency light which disturbs during the night. This problem should really be improved in single rooms

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: kador01
Reviews.Content: Very good situation in the Eixample area but very close to the old town. Nice helping people, someone speaks french (helpful for us) and everyone speaks english, spanish and catalan. Internet was a bit slow on ethernet, too slow on wifi. Ethernet available in the rooms. The hotel is beautiful and the restaurant was just amazing. Degustation menu was available for 13,50 euros, including 4 plates, the drinks (water, wine, ...) and even a glass of champagne (cava). Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: hereWorld
Reviews.Content: We loved being close to everything, and within easy reach of all the sights. The hotel staff is very nice and helpful, at any hour. I liked that it is a small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Ireneok
Reviews.Content: Really good Hotel near to top places, clean rooms, friendly services.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anwag
Reviews.Content: All in one pretty good, good value for money.A little bit noise (because of the tiled floor- in rooms and corridors - which on the other hand looks nice and feels more clean than some carpets). Only spanish tv, but did not bother that much. very clean and good location.

Reviews.Title: “modern clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: sven-bristol
Reviews.Content: Found Constanza a modern, contempory and clean hotel. Spacious, room, nice bathroom & shower. rooms onto the front road are a little noisey early in the morning although. but our friends had a room on the back which had a sizable bacony and overlooked the middle of the block and was quiet (apart for when the kindergarden below let bthe kids out for playtime) unfortunatly no bar in the hotel which was a little dissapointing although there are plent y of bars & cafes in the surrounding streets.didnt have breakfast at the constanza but heard it was qiute expensive. there is a cafe on other side of the road which did tea & coffe cakes etc, and was good and resonable but if you are a non smoker beware. Hotel in good location, 15 minute walk to La Rambla, location seemed safe enough at night. Cost me 42 euros to get to from airport by taxi Liked this hotel, I would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel .. noisy room though”
Reviews.Author: cfc_7
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Constanza. Located a convenient distance away (easy 10 minute stroll) from Placa Catalunya in C. Bruc, and just 60 metres from the major road, Gran Via Corts Catalanes. The hotel is ideally placed for walking to the areas' many attractions. The hotel is clean, modern and well kept and the staff are all excellent... being friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The room that I stayed in (a suite actually) was spacious and well appointed, with an excellent bathroom comprising huge walk-in shower, approximately 7 feet long! The room was serviced daily by the maids and left in "as new" condition. My only gripe was that my particular room was noisy. It was on the 4th floor at the front of the building, but the soundproofing on the balcony door left a lot to be desired. In my unscientific estimation, I would say that it blocked out no more than 70 of outside noise, so you would continuously hear the drone of vehicles going up and down Gran Via Corts Catalanes... and the police sirens on that street sounded like they were just outside on the balcony! To compound matters further, the maids' store room was right next door, so I was awoken early on a couple of mornings by their comings and goings. I am a very light sleeper, so the noise had a big effect on the amount of sleep that I got... approx 5 hours each night! I didn't use the restaurant, so cannot comment on it. I would have given this hotel a full 5 star rating if it wasn't for the noise issue that I encountered. However, I would recommend it without reservation and would definitely stay there again... although I would insist on a room at the back of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: christinePenarth
Reviews.Content: Plesant reception staff. Nice room with balcony, overlooking street but very good sound proofing. Good bathroom with fantastic shower. Breakfast fine but no variation, might be a problem for an extended stay. Great location within walking distance of many sights as well as lots of restaurants and bars. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Geoff083
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Constanza for our first wedding anniversary. The hotel's staff were great and really helpful. We arrived at 11pm on a Saturday night and were greeted in English and advised of a great Tapas Bar nearby for dinner. We realy couldn't have asked for more. The room was lovely (we'd upgraded to a suite for roughly £10 extra per night), with a huge balcony that looked out from the back of the hotel. The view wasn't great, but it was very pleasant to sit out and soak up the last of the day's sun.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay if you are going to Barcelona for a week.”
Reviews.Author: noviygera
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, modern looking hotel in a quiet/formal district. Rooms are very well designed, good balcony, comfy bed. If you want a trendy/hip neighborhood, look for a hotel in "born" district, not this neighborhood. Breakfasts are not very good, eat better food for less in a local restaurant. However, the hotel itself is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: metrohoper
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. The room was very nice. It was well decorated, the bed was comfy, and it was very clean. The bathroom was great as well. The shower was amazing. The staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel was pretty conveniently located. There's a metro right near the hotel, but you could just as well walk to anywhere in the city. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Content: Extremely well located small hotel. Most of the major tourist destinations are 10-15 minutes walking. Plenty of lunch/dinner choices of good quality nearby. Located on quiet, safe street. We had some problems with internet, eventually got it working. There was no ethernet cable in the room, BYO. Expect about 2Mbps download speed. Cons: very dim bathroom lighting, impossible to shave; no iron, no coffeemaker. Very comfortable good size room (405, facing the street, small balcony). We got a great non-refundable deal through priceline/booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern Hotel close to the Old Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jabien
Reviews.Content: We were staying in Provence with my family and my wife and I just wanted a little getaway for couple of days just the two of us and so we drove to Barcelona and chose this hotel based on the reviews we red on TripAdvisor. This was the perfect location to be. Only a 5 minutes walk to the old Barcelona. Rooms were modern and simple but elegant at the same time. I know this is not where you spend most of your time but the bathroom was pretty cool, shower was huge. For the price we paid it was a pretty good deal. We didn't go for room +breakfast though as we thought it will just be better to experience food outside the hotel by having "cafe y croissant" deal at local cafes for pretty cheap. So I don't know how good or bad the breakfast is over there. Staff speaks French and English (depending on who is at the front desk). If you go back to Barcelona I would go back to Hotel Constanza right away. I little tip for parking if you're driving: parking is free in August in certain area. I'm glad the guy at the front desk told me.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TNEG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Constanza for 4 nights during a trip to Spain last spring. The hotel is in a great location, very close to the central tourist section (Placa de Catalunya/Las Ramblas) but just enough away to be fairly quiet. The hotel is very modern in decor, but the rooms are fairly large and comfortable. We had the breakfast one morning, which was rather disappointing as there was not a large selection available. While the hotel was quite nice, we were disappointed in the attitude of the staff. As an example, on our way to the airport we asked the front desk staff to call us a taxi. The guy said he had a friend who would be there in 5 minutes, and we'd get a deal on the fare. His friend did show up, but told us he had a quick errand to run and would be back in 5 minutes. We waited 25 minutes, with no sign of the driver but with the front desk man telling us not to worry and not to leave. Finally, we just went and got our own cab. So that was definitely disappointing, and the main complaint we had about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK room, bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Ishay27
Reviews.Content: The staff were very nice and helpful, but - the cold room's floor was very unpleasant, and the breakfast is very very poor (not a single hot dish, very cheap artificial orange juice)

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: Siropku
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Constanza based on the positive reviews on Trip Advisor and couldn't be happier with my choice. Its location in L'Eixample was perfect: close to lots of great restaurants and shops, and away from the noises of Las Ramblas. We felt very safe in the neighbourhood - somehow I didn't feel this way around Las Ramblas. The front desk staff was great and helpful with a sense of humour. Our housekeeping lady was lovely. The breakfast was good value - I love the Spanish tortilla they had every morning! The hotel also had free internet so we were able to keep in touch with the world during our stay. I made our reservation online but wasn't given a reservation number, so I emailed the hotel. As it turned out, the booking didn't go through so they made a reservation for me. I always reconfirm my online bookings with an email to get an acknowledgment from the hotel. There's nothing worse than going halfway around the world to discover there's no room for me! It was definitely a good choice and great value. I'll go back to the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: lodochica
Reviews.Content: Convenient to everything...the airport bus drop/pick up, metro stops, shopping, and everything Gaudi. On a quieter street away from heavy traffic. Thankfully not too close to the overly busy tourist hub (La Rambla, etc), but not a long walk if you want to go there. Clean, beautiful decor, and really friendly staff. Couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “VERY CONFORTABLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BONFYPiacenza
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very confortable, the room was very clean and had got new forniture and a fantastic shower box, the location is good near Plaza Cataluna and the metro station, the staff is very kind, I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but needs less ambient lighting”
Reviews.Author: LindaLouSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The staff speaks English and is very helpful. My room was clean and comfortable. My only two gripes are that my mini bar had four empty bottles of expensive liquor in it. Luckily I checked the bar as soon as I walked in and went down to inform the desk. They didn't charge me; however, I didn't get replacements either. Also, the rooms seems to have the same ambient lighting as an expensive restaurant. It was hard to read and rather silly I thought. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don’t hesitate, just go there and see for yourself how nice it is!”
Reviews.Author: Wij2
Reviews.Content: In October 2009 we got married in Barcelona and decided to book 15 rooms in Hotel Constanza at Carrer del Bruc 33. Apart from that, we wanted to throw a cocktail party for 60 persons on the hotel’s rooftop terrace. Though we had only seen a few pictures of the lobby and the rooms on the hotel’s website, we immediately knew it: this hotel would be our nr. 1 choice. And what a choice it was! Hotel staff was very efficient, professional and helpful, but above all they stayed so friendly during our one week stay. Just like the staff of restaurant Con Calma: they provided us with a delicious breakfast each morning and organized the wonderful cocktail party that made our wedding night into an unforgettable event. They even redecorated the rooftop terrace for this special occasion! Did we already mention the boutique rooms, very comfortable beds, bath rooms with rain showers and the hotel’s superb location? So … who needs a huge flat screen TV in a city like Barcelona (although all rooms have one :-) Don’t hesitate, just go there and see for yourself how nice it is! Zosha & Guido Note: do not confuse this Hotel Constanza with the NH Constanza.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynTraveler_9
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something with old world charm, this is not the place. But if you want a comfortable, modern hotel with a good price in a good location in Barcelona, check out Hotel Constanza. My friend and I chose single rooms and though quite small, the room was comfortable and sparkling clean. The price for the room with tax and breakfast was only 80 euros, which I thought was a great deal. The breakfast was very good and the location is just a short walk from Placa de Catalunya, where the airport bus leaves you off. We were able to walk to both the old and new town with no problem. Just minutes from the Ramblas. All in all, a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for independant travellers that need comfort and security”
Reviews.Author: bh256tr
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be in good condition, the room excellent and the hotel was the best 3 star rating hotel we stayed in Spain. After travelling for two months in Spain it was great to have a comfortable bed. We had a room on the front of the hotel and thanks to the double glazing there was no street noise. Internally we could hear people in the rooms above and adjacent. TV noise, moving chairs, and plumbing noises were the most common. That said it did not disturb us greatly. But if you had noisier people nearby perhaps it could be disturbing. Location was good. The Gothic quarter, Plaza Cataluna and the Ramblas were easy walking. Would certainly suggest purchasing a T10 pass which gives discounted travel on the bus, metro and some rail services as many of the places of interest are some distance. Front desk staff were helpful and answered all of our questions. Cannot comment on the restaurant as we did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with some hickups”
Reviews.Author: HenrikS3
Reviews.Content: Everything was OK and quite good except interfering noice from roms closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Met all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Mhaincin
Reviews.Content: First, the positives: a quiet island in a heavy traffic area, 5 min walk to Placa de Catalunya and all its public transport options, spotlessly clean, understated/ 'cool' hotel, extremely helpful but unobstrusive staff, free internet access, cosy lobby, the 'noise' issue in other reviews is over-stated, the rooms are of a good size and well furnished Negatives: suites have twin beds only, and they are very 'hard'!, rooms are poorly lit - so much so that it is almost impossible to read that holiday book. Nice surprises: Dinner at Euro 20.00 (includes a 'large' glass of excellent quality wine) is good value and the complimentary glass of Brut afterwards was a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Money well spent”
Reviews.Author: MCTMalta
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel after being advised about it by a friend who described it as "great" Being centrally located we found we had easy walking access to all the tourist hotspots such as the Ramblas, the port, the Gothic area and the park but also the best shopping streets of Barcelona. The hotel's employees were great and very helpful throughout our stay and the rooms were kept spotless daily by the cleaning staff. The room was spacious and comfortable with ample storage space. If I could make one comment it would be that the lights, although in line with the modern decor, would be better if they were brighter. All in All I recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Constanza is very friendly and efficient.”
Reviews.Author: WindstarDenver
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated, near City Center. The staff is most efficient and ready to help. It is a good choice for the traveler who wants a good breakfast to start the day, free internet service, and a clean and sufficiently appointed room that does not require luxury because the traveler will be out all day. The exterior doors and windows are very well insulated, blocking 99 percent of the street noise even on the lower floors. My wife and I enjoyed two stays at the Constnaza for a total of six nights and will recommend it to our friends and business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, excellent location but a little dark..”
Reviews.Author: Kingston34
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an exceptional location 5 - 10 mins walk from Plaza Catalunya. It is within reasonable walking distance of Sagrada Familia, the Port area, Parc de la Cuitadella, Palau de la Musica Catalana, Las Ramblas and a number of other attractions. Despite being so close to the action the street it is on is extremely quiet. There are a couple of supermarkets near by and loads of bars and restaurants in the area. There are also 4 or 5 metro stations within 10 minutes walk. The staff are friendly and polite and the free internet use in reception is extremely useful. The hotel has been nicely designed and it looks fairly classy. The rooms are good, clean, have a great shower and ours had the added bonus of our balcony. Because of the colour scheme and some fairly poor lighting it was quite dark. My girlfriend found this very inconvenient when getting ready in the evening and it just made it a bit dingy sometimes. You know how occasionally you stay in a hotel where you feel really comfortable spending time in the room and enjoy being there (not that you should be there much in Barcelona!), this just didn't have that feel about it. That said, I would definitely recommend the Hotel because for quality and location it would be difficult to find much better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stevelikesrice
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend for a couple of days in July. The hotel is a little bit away (but an easily walkable distance) from the main square and Las Ramblas etc, and is only 2 blocks from a metro station. We found the area convenient and easy to navigate. The hotel itself is modern-ish, clean, and relatively inexpensive. The hotel staff was friendly and was fluent in English. They also gave helpful advice regarding the metro, places to eat, supermarkets etc. Our room was clean and had all the amenities one would expect. Pictures on the hotel website and on TA are fairly representative. Overall a great stay. Would recommend without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: skanebbar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Constanza for two days in October; one day before our cruise and one day after. Having traveled overnight from New York to Barcelona, it was wonderful that our rooms were ready when we arrived at the hotel in the early morning. The hotel staff was very helpful in directing us to where we could find the “Hop On/Hop Off Tour Bus” at Plaza Catalunya. This was a great way to get an overview of the city. Hotel Constanza is well situated so that you can walk to Las Ramblas and other areas. We found the rooms to be clean, modern, and comfortable. We would definitely return to the Hotel Constanza.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibaly nice room and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Max_Lei
Reviews.Content: We had 1 week's stay in Barcelona, we reserved 3 hotels (all look nice and have good location online) online that we all want to experience. Hotel Constanza is no doubt the best! We are surprised by the great design and decoration of the hotel lobby as soon as we enter and feel even better when we enter the room. It is modern, luxury and comfortable. The service is also great. Not to mention the location. Next time we travel to Barcelona, we will only choose Hotel Constanza.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, stylish and clean hotel with large room and balcony.”
Reviews.Author: bayshill
Reviews.Content: The location is great-we walked everywhere from here. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and there is free computer/internet access provided in the lobby. The room was spacious and the bed very large with nice sheets and very well cleaned with an in room safe and fridge. Good value overall. The only downside is no room service and no residents' bar or tea/coffee facility-there is a restaurant next door where the buffet breakfast is provided, but it was closed at tea time and late at night when a nightcap would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgny57
Reviews.Content: The hotel was convenient to most sites. Staff was friendly. Rates were reasonable. Free internet in room (they supplied ethernet wire if needed) and two terminals in lobby. Room was a little dark. Could use more drawer space.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: zoothemoo
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - walking distance of the main tourist sights but quiet enough at night to sleep. Our double room was fine; albeit a bit dark due to energy saving lightbulbs. Balcony was available though we didn't get a very scenic side. Air-con worked well and large LCD TV in room with multilingual channels available. Size-wise, pretty standard for Europe. Shower was excellent - no problems with water pressure or hot water supply. Bathroom was modern. Room clean and staff friendly. We may have been lucky, but despite our stay coinciding with a wedding, it wasn't particularly noisy. All in all, an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: oscarandmia
Reviews.Content: We loved it...great room, great location, comfort meant a lot at the end of the day after a long day of walking around sightseeing and Hotel Constanza definitely delivered....the shower was heaven, bed linen clean and made up every day and it all came at an affordable price....

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further!”
Reviews.Author: Gretelann
Reviews.Content: Hotel Constanza was by far the perfect choice for our trip to Barcelona. Very conveniently located - within walking distance of all the action. The staff was very pleasant and attentive, rooms immaculate, along with a nice buffet breakfast and very reasonable rates for a city hotel. You won't go wrong with this gem.

Reviews.Title: “What a great choice”
Reviews.Author: shueyHampshire
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 8 girls on a hen weekend. Was very impressed. Location perfect staff very helpful and rooms were just perfect for the weekend. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Very helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: FERDOUZ
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at Hotel Contstanza. The staff are very helpful. Lighting could be improved near the closets. However, the Hotel's location, style and comfort make up for anything missing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: FrankOhio
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic for a base in Barcelona; only a few blocks from several Metro stops including Plaza Catalunya; but, on a fairly quiet side street (Bruc) that avoids the constant buzz of the Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya area. Also, only a few blocks from the Eixample area. Hundreds of great restaurants, bars, and cafes within 10-15 minutes walk on safe streets. Actually, the location is so good that we typically walked everywhere. The room is contemporary in design and lighting, plenty large for two, great shower, small balcony, and quiet (we never heard any noise at night), and it was cleaned immaculately every morning. We stayed for seven nights and the price was great (90 euro per night) compared to other hotels we have stayed at in Barcelona. The hotel is best if you want a great location and don't need all the extra services of a hotel such as bar, spa, exercise room, etc. The two free computers (internet) in the lobby were all we needed; and the front desk staff were always friendly and helpful with suggestions, directions, and translations. For the price, this is the best hotel we have found for what we like to do in cities such as Barcelona, Madrid, Lisbon, etc. Most of the customers appeared to be adults between 30 to 60. Again, this is not the hotel for people who want all of the extra services and amenities of a large business/travel hotel. But it is a great choice for its location, price, comfort, and quality of service if you intend to use it as a base to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value, but very loud”
Reviews.Author: staceytann
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was a good value for Barcelona and enjoyed the location, but the noise level reminded me of living in a dorm! The noise from any activity in the hallway was ridiculous. And there was no real customer service - most of the time the staff didn't even look up to see who was entering the hotel. A good value, good location, but I wouldn't come back. With all the hotels in Barcelona, there has got to be one better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: BrightonAndy
Reviews.Content: Barcelona has a bewildering number of hotels to choose from, but the Constanza fitted the bill perfectly for us. Whilst I love a posh hotel as much as the next person I was more interested in finding a hotel with a great location that didn't cost the earth. If you're happy to sacrifice an integral restaurant/bar and a swimming pool for a hotel that's in really safe neighbourhood and within easy strolling distance of the centre of the city, then the Constanza is the one for you. It's worth noting the restaurant next door is affiliated with the hotel, so you can still get breakfast/lunch/dinner as if it were part of the hotel, though it's worth bearing in mind if it's quiet they'll close, so don't rely on eating there! The reception and staff are welcoming and the rooms look just like on the website, how often does that happen? The rooms are simple but stylish and the bathroom had the most wonderfully powerful shower, perfect after a days sightseeing! Our suite had a large terrace with two reclining chairs, table and parasol. Sipping a glass of wine before going out to dinner on the terrace sure beat any hotel bar, and was cheaper too thanks to the supermarket just around the corner! The hotel forms part of a square of buildings, and as we were located at the back it was blissfully quiet. Even though the hotel is just three blocks from the madness that is the centre of Barcelona we slept with the window open and weren't disturbed once by the outside world. Unfortunately the same can't be said inside the building. The sound proofing really is as non-existent as previous reviewers have mentioned. That said we weren't disturbed during the night and were only awoken once by the people in the room next door in the morning. I'm fairly noise conscious, but didn't think the noise was unreasonable, I had ear plugs just in case, though I didn't need to use them. All in all the Constanza is a great choice. For €100 per night we had a spacious suite three blocks from the main square and two blocks from the nearest metro station. Definitely recommended if you'd rather spend time sightseeing than spending loads of time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: tarocks1
Reviews.Content: Decor was very sleek & modern. Very clean & comfortable rooms. Only place I would slightly disagree with other posts is the location, which was good but I wouldn't say great. Centrally located, but for our purposes (3 days, mostly sightseeing) still plenty of walking involved (given its a huge city so to be expected). We were in Barcelona over a weekend and nothing in the immediate neighborhood (couple of block radius) seemed to be home for most of our stay. That being said had a very positive experience and for the price would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, clean, comfortable, good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: haute-epoque
Reviews.Content: A very attractive, comfortable and spotlessly clean hotel in an excellent location. A couple of gripes. First, there was no hot water for 24 hours. Not too much of a problem as it was blisteringly hot and a cool shower was quite pleasant, but still... Second, the sound proofing is far from perfect. Could hear furniture being dragged across the floor above and the sound of the TV. With the exception of one individual, all the staff were friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “lovely barcelona hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fslater312
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a suite (all that was available) and really enjoyed our stay. Breakfast was lovely, great location on south end of the Eixample, but close enough to walk everywhere-which we did. Also great public transportation options-metro 1 block away, 3 blocks from Placa Catalunya. Great city-great food-great fun! Good tapas place El Tapa Madre -4 blocks up on Carrer Bruc.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hotelcamping
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night after our cruise. We found this to be very clean, stylish and comfortable. The room was small but had a spacious balcony for relaxing. The bathroom and shower are large by most European standards with a very tall raindrop shower head that my husband (6'3") enjoyed. We enjoyed the free internet in the lobby and relaxing on the sofas after a lot of walking. The area was quiet but easy to find on a map and only two blocks from a metro station. The staff was polite and eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmkjax
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Hotel Constanza based on the reviews from Trip Advisor. We stayed at Hotel Constanza at the end of our 12 day Mediterranean cruise. We arrived around noon and were able to get into our rooms immediately. The staff was very friendly and helpful giving directions, ordering taxis, etc. The hotel is very nicely decorated and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast was more than adequate. We were in walking distance to LaRambla and to the Hop On Hop Off bus tour which was an excellent way to see the city with only a short amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, quiet and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Fruitf
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance from metro. Sagrada and Cathedral. Just enough out of tourist areas to be quiet but easy to walk in. Hotel was very clean and modern with good airconditioning and free internet in the lobby. Breakfast was adequate and fresh. Concierge could be a little more friendly, not that I like over familiar. If you like a good nights sleep and don't mind a 10-15 min walk to most sights then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDW82
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel just 5 mins walk from placa de catalunya. Its in a slightly quiet area of town (mainly shopping) so its a 5/10 mins walk to any of the restaurants/ bars on La Rambla and 15 mins walk down to the Barrio Gotic. It is well situated near to the tube so that it is only a 5/10 minute ride down to the beach at la Barceloneta and the bars/ restaurants at Port Olimpic. Very clean, staff were helpful (giving restaurant and bar/ nightclub tips) and all in all a recommended stop for people visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Tolgay
Reviews.Content: Pretty close to all leisure areas, only 10 minutes walk, but more important you can sleep in a quiet place afterwards. We stayed in a suit room and was very comfortable staying with our daughter. Stuff was very friendly, rooms are clean and spacious, priceworthy for every detail. I won't ever seek for any other place in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms, very helpful staff, good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: PipaNewYork
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfortable rooms, very helpful staff, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Zuban
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. It's within walking distance (a lazy 10 minutes) from Las Ramblas and the main square. We didn't feel unsafe walking to and from the hotel. The hotel itself was clean and modern. The rooms were great. Quiet and some having a nice balcony onto the road. Two computers connected to the Internet were available in the lobby. Staff were very friendly particularly the lady at the bar, who always served us with a smile. The only thing which was disappointing was the breakfast, but there's not much else locally unless you walk to Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCherie
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Constanza for the last two nights of our Barcelona vacation. The hotel was clean, modern, comfortable and very nice. Breakfast was included and there was free internet. The hotel is well situated a few blocks to the Placa de Catalunya, where the main tourist office and various transportation are located. We would definitely recommend the Hotel Constanza.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ROOM/LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: gogyrl
Reviews.Content: We chose HC because of the price and location. Very clean and generally safe area within walking distance of the museums and sights we were interested in. GREAT bathroom, cleanliness, low noise (even on the street side w/ small balcony), NOT SO GREAT parking wasn't close by.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel; Perfect Location; Terrific Price”
Reviews.Author: GAlawyer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Barcelona this spring for a quick 5 day trip and stayed at the Hotel Constanza. This hotel was a terrific find. We dilligently researched our hotel options and the Constanza offered the best balance of price, quality, and location. We couldn't be happier with our decision. Rooms: The Constanza is small, boutique hotel with modern, yet comfortable, furnishings. Be sure and ask for a room with a balcony facing the street. Since we were out enjoying Barcelona most of the time, we were only in our room to sleep and shower-up before heading out at night. The beds were comfy and shower was wonderful. We have no complaints whatsoever about our room. Location: The Constanza is located on a quite side street, so street noise (apparently a problem at some Barcelona hotels) was not an issue. The hotel is in a great location just north of Barri Gothic. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk to Placa Catalyuna/Las Ramblas, and 10 minutes to El Born. The location was terrific and the short walk was never an issue. There are pleny to cafes close to the Constanza for breakfast/coffee. No matter which direction we headed in the morining, we always seemed to pass a nice spot for breakfast on the way -- a nice perk. Cabs are plentiful, but the only time we used a cab was late at night, when the 10 minute walk after a day of sight seeing (and night of drinks) wasnt' worth it. A quick cab home to the Constanz from Barri Gothic or El Born was never more than 8 euro. Price: The price was outstanding. Weeknights were 90 euro and weekends 120 euro. Overall, we had a wonderful stay at the Constanza and will certainly consider it when going back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: Bunnis
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews on Trip Advisor and had also seen this hotel suggested in our Fodor's guide book. We were very pleased with the hotel and its staff. We especially enjoyed the fact that it was away from the nose and bustle of Las Ramblas, but close enough to be in the centre of it all within minutes. The hotel is modern and comfortable with an adequate breakfast. We would certainly stay there again given it's reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, sleek hotel and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: govindblr
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews of the hotel on Trip Advisor before selecting this hotel for our 5 day stay in Barcelona. Location: Centrally located. 10 minute walk from La Ramblas and very close to the metro stations - Passeig de Gracia and Tetuan. Most of the major sights of the city such as the Picasso Museum, the history musuem, La Rambla, Gaudi's Casa Mila and Casa Battlo are within a 20 minute walk. Hotel: The rooms are elegant and modern in design. Loved the beds - very comfortable and we got a suite with a balcony. Although the room has a mini-bar, we picked up a bottle of wine from outside. There are 2 wine glasses and a corkscrew provided in the room. The flatscreen t.v is great, though most channels are in Spanish with a few English news and music channels. Complimentary breakfast is wholesome and sets you up for the day. I would recommend including the breakfast as part of the stay - for 6 Euro you can have a great breakfast (eggs, juice, fruits, croissants, yogurt, toast, ham and cheese). The staff is polite and helpful. We picked up maps and brochures from the front desk. Also loved the fact that the room cleaning staff had arranged our personal stuff by the time we got back to the room each day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Constanza is a sharp, modern hotel with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: socalgalTO
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers modern, clean rooms with a complimentary breakfast. The value is 5 star. We enjoyed our stay immensely! The staff is very friendly and helpful. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: CASPEED
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel 5 days. Staff very friendly and helpful, front desk attended 24/7. Nice modern decor. We booked a double room with a balcony. Very clean, nice sized room. A friend stayed in a single (we would not recomend) too small. Breakfast was ok with a good selection of food. We had alot that we wanted to do/see and opted for the breakfast so that we could get a quick start in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a pretty good deal”
Reviews.Author: marathonrunner13
Reviews.Content: we found the hotel clean, staff pretty helpful (needed the safe fixed and an extra pillow which were quickly supplied, and helped us with booking train tickets). Hotel is in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “You might be pickpocketed on Las Ramblas, but you could also be pickpocketed by Hotel Constanza.”
Reviews.Author: ReeseNable
Reviews.Content: Hotel Constanza is trying hard to be an upscale boutique hotel, but failing miserably. The service from the initial check-in process to the maid service was pathetic. When we arrived, the room was not ready; we were tired and hungry but the desk staff did not suggest we go to their attached restaurant (Concalma). Once in the room there was no way to contact the reception desk (no phone list, no information booklet, no pen, no paper). The room's door did not lock (seriously, when trying to leave we closed the door behind us and it would just push open). The shower drain was clogged and drained slowly (nothing like taking a shower in standing water). The bathroom sink began draining directly on the floor. One morning there was no hot water (nothing like a cold shower in the morning). If you're staying more than one day, don't expect your room to be cleaned until late (3:00, 2:30, 3:15). So much for a siesta. No need to set an alarm clock (construction begins promptly at 8:00 a.m.). On our final day the maid had no soap or toilet paper (we had to use shampoo and grab toilet paper from the lobby restroom). Checking out, the desk staff resisted thanking us until two of us first said "thank you." These are shortcomings unacceptable anywhere but possibly expected at budget accommodations. Hotel Constanza is not marketing itself as a budget accommodation. Barcelona has many options, don't waste your time or money on Hotel Constanza.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Auntycon
Reviews.Content: We found this Hotel on tripadvisor and what a find. It is right where you want to be; quite neighborhood, and a short walk to everything. We caught the city tourist bus three blocks or so from the hotel and we found the staff personal most helpful. We received recommendations on great places to eat, and directions to anything that we requested. We would certainly stay here again when we return without any hesitation.. Great Breakfast also that is included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: SGi77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Constanza over June. The position of the Hotel is perfect since it is only 5 min walk from plaza Catalynia right in the centre of Barcelona. Although it is in the centre the street that the hotel is located is very quite. The breakfast is very good. We found the personnel of the hotel very polite and always pleasant to assist us in any inquiries regarding the city , the sightseeing, the nightlife and the local good restaurants. We were impressed with the cleanliness and the really nice smell of the rooms and the halls of the hotel. Overall we had an excellent stay at Constanza hotel and If I ever travel again to Barcelona I will surely choose again to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel I would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: rkm4523
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on trip advisor and they were so helpful that I had to write my own. Hotel Constanza was awesome! A great modern hotel that was really clean and was reasonable priced. After a long flight I was so happy to see that the rooms were clean and the hotel was excellent. Sam the front desk guy was so helpful in telling us about all the spots and even foiled a purse snatcher right in front of the hotel. Amazing! (As a side note be careful in Barcelona, we heard of two people who got their wallets stolen while we were there. They target older adults). The only thing negative I could say is that the area is very quiet at night since all the party spots are near the water. But only a short cab ride away. The breakfast also got pretty old real quick. On the whole though I would definitely go back to this hotel. Oh and if you have a chance book the double marriage or the suite (The suite was large with super balcony).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Excellent Service & Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Saicilia
Reviews.Content: This is a MUST STAY hotel! Quality of the room and service are way above average. Extremely helpful staffs, nice room, tasty breakfast, excellent location, minutes to everywhere~ I will definitely stay in this hotel again if I ever go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “what else do you want ?!”
Reviews.Author: h3kamal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new with contemporary furniture and design. Nice center location 10 minutes walk to “Placa de Catalunya”, quite neighborhood. We had a room with balcony facing the street with nice large double-sound-isolated windows. We paid 90 Euro for two without breakfast. There is a nice fancy Thai restaurant in the corner of the street but we didn’t try it because we came back at midnight.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be”
Reviews.Author: JR_murdoch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon last week. Booked through their own website and got breakfast inc for same price. Was only twin available but put request for double and they made sure that was catered for (twins zipped together but it was fine) Walls are a bit thin but nothing to worry about. Breakfast cold buffet but fequently topped up, usual meats cheese, cereals cakes etc good to fill up before trek out. 5 mins walk from Las Ramblas (£5.50 pint £7 outside go drinking off the main street !) Sights of Barcelona fantastic great place to honeymoon and great base to stay

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: scottishannie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for a long weekend. Hotel is very modern and clean. We booked an appartment with balcony. The room was beautifully furnished with a small kichen area. The kitchen area is not well appointed enough to be able to cook anything but enough for a cuppa and a sandwich. Not that you would want to cook anyway. Balcony didnt really have a view other than the street below. However, if you were there in summer it would be lovely to sit out and read a book. Hotel was spotlessly clean and staff were very helpful. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel, went to the cafe across the road. The location is fantastic. In a quiet street but only five mins walk to the place de catalyna and las Ramblas. For the amount we paid I was very pleased with this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Should be top of the list of choices for a short stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Probman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite here. Boutique hotel with modern , clean, angular lines. Lots of dark wood & stone panels. Huge bedroom, plus seating & dressing area and fabulous shower room. Only 3 blocks from Placa Catalunya so 10 minutes walking will get you to there and the top of La Rambla, yet on a fairly quiet street. The reception staff were very helpful and responded instantly and expertly to requests for fixes (room safe would not open) or information (the best metro line to take etc).

Reviews.Title: “Small and perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: monkeylyn
Reviews.Content: Just back from a business trip to Barcelona where I stayed in this hotel. Fantastic location and modern finish. Breakfast is good - great fresh pineapple, pastries, cakes etc. I was in a single room which is a little small but does the job if you're not planning to stay in it much bar sleep. I would recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at the Constanza”
Reviews.Author: Beckiboo1983
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Constanza based solely on the reviews on this website. We're a young couple in our twenties and value for money is everything to us! After doing extensive research it seemed that this hotel was our best option for around €100 a night. Infact, several hotels charging much more than this had a lot worse reviews - Hotel Constanza was something like 22nd out of 500+ hotels in Barcelona when I checked this site - and very reasonably priced. I used the hotel's online booking system - we planned 5 nights in Barcelona over the New Year so I expected some increase in the normal price. I was pleasantly suprised - each night was €100 for a double suite, and it went up to €130 for NYE and NYD - very reasonable in my opinion. Our room was a lovely double suite, done up in minimalistic colours and furniture. The beds were comfy and clean, we had a balcony looking to the back of the hotel, and a spotless bathroom. I can't really think of anything to fault the hotel room-wise. One small niggle for me personally was that the room was quite dark, they had spotlights in the ceiling which made it very romantic, but quite dark when you need to do your hair/make up! (Probably just a girly gripe!) Breakfast was served til 10.30am on normal days, and at the lovely time of midday on 1st Jan, which would have been great, except we didn'[t get up til 4pm. Anyway, on the days we did have breakfast, it was fine; toast, cereals, croissants, ham, cheese, pastries etc. Everything you need to fill you up before a day's siteseeing. The staff were friendly and polite, although we didn't really have much to do with them during our stay. The hotel is about a 10min walk from Plaza De Catalunya (where all the main tourist buses leave from), 15mins walk from Las Ramblas, and maybe 30mins to the beach. We love walking so basically walked everywhere we could, this hotel was perfectly situated for us. All in all a very pleasant stay there, very glad I chose it.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled price-to-quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: kala327
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't come up high on any travel guide's list (tripadvisor included) so I don't recall exactly how I stumbled across it, but once I did, I'm I researched it heavily as the price (90 euros a night with breakfast included) seemed to good to be true for a hotel near the desirable Eixample area of Barcelona. I contacted the property directly in the summer (via email in Spanish) and they told me that the low rate was due to renovations of the hotel - renovations that would be done in September. My stay was for November so no concern there. The hotel is well-located. Just a few blocks from the Passeig de Gracia and Plaza Catalunya. It's not a block or two away, but rather 4 or five city blocks so if being a stone's throw away (walking-distance-wise) from the center of action is important to you then this might not be the place for you. The hotel met all expectations. The rooms were super modern and minimalist - in a sense almost too minimalist as there wasn't even an alarm clock in the room. For the base price of 90 euros (base price for a standard double), I had a large terrace with chairs and a table overlooking the back of the hotel. The back does not face a street rather other people's/other buildings "backyards". Breakfast ticked all the boxes and was in a sleek, if not small room adjacent to their cafe - the latter which is accessible to the public. (They have a clever sliding door which separates the cafe from the breakfast room for hotel guests.) I imagine that later in the day the divider retracts in to the wall and the entire space is usable for the cafe open to the public. My only quip was that upon returning to the room for a bit after the midafternoon meal, the door was propped open. While I use the in-room safe for valuables such as passports and extra cash, I nonetheless typically put out the "Do Not Disturb" sign as I prefer the cleaning people not to enter the room as (1) I typically don't make much mess and (2) for security reasons. However, the cleaning people not only disregarded the "do not disturb" sign, but while they were cleaning they apparently used the deadbolt to leave the door propped open and then neglected to come by when they finished to close it. It was a bit unsettling to return to the room to find the door propped open. Luckily nothing was stolen, but I did go down to the front desk to comment to the staff (in Spanish). Seems the cleaning people were in the process of finishing for the day so the desk manager went with me to talk to them before they left. They admitted they went in despite the "do not disturb sign" being on the door as well as leaving the door open. The cleaning staff apologized as well as the desk staff. They hotel didn't do anything above and beyond that, but frankly I was just grateful that all was well, so no harm no foul. Luckily I returned during the day around when the lapse happened as who knows what could have been taken from the room had it been left open like that for hours? That could have been another story entirely. Due to the security lapse, I cannot give the hotel a glowing review, but all-in-all it was a very pleasant stay and you can't beat the price-quality ratio in what is THE neighborhood to stay in in Barcelona. I don't know if it will stay 90 euros for much longer, but I would even pay a bit more to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: DW1872
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel in an ideal location. 5 minutes from the Metro and 10 minutes from Las Ramblas. Clean, great rooms, friendly staff, excellent breakfast, great shower! We couldn't fault the place and would definetley go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WendyAnneNZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend break to Barcelona and I was really impressed. Hotels in Barcelona aren't cheap but I felt this offered value for money. We had a great room with a balcony and the double glazing meant we didn't hear any street noise - we both had an amazing sleep on the large and comfortable bed. The shower was fantastic and the staff were great. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but we did have drinks and cocktails and the service was really good. The location of this hotel is brilliant. It is on a quieter street, but within walking distance of central Barcelona. The only transport we used all weekend was our feet! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Modern with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jbak88
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Barcelona, and the Hotel Constanza was a winner! Clean and modern, with sleek decor and a lovely rainfall shower. Big balcony with seating. The location was good, three (long) blocks from Plaza Catalunya, so taking the Aerobus from the airport was cheap and convenient. Service was great, and a decent breakfast buffet is included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Constanza”
Reviews.Author: Jerseycitygirl07
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel Constanza. The room was modern, clean and spacious for European standards. We had a balcony that was huge! The location was great- very close to the subway. The staff were really helpful and very friendly. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying at Hotel Constanza.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo305
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Constanza was a struggle to find since the taxi driver was convinced that there was no hotel on Carrier de Bruc. However, once found the staff greeted us warmly and checked us into our room. Now the Constanza is currently under refurbishment hence the cheaper room rates but this did not intrude on our stay. The noise levels other reviews have mentioned were not as high as I anticipated ( maybe we were lucky and had free rooms on either side of ours) The room was very clean and had a contemporary feel to the decoration. The balcony was a nice touch and the staff were very helpful in bringing us an iron to the room. The only downsides were that the bathroom is very very small and its only really a shower rather than a bath shower combo, and the room was a twin room with two beds pushed together which was a slight dissappointment. The loation of this hotel is excellent with only a 10 minute walk to La Rambla and the Gothic region is only a 5 minute walk away. Taxi's to and from teh Port Olympic Beaches cost roughly EUR 5-6 although it is best to tell the drivers to drop you at the corner of Carrier de Brucc and Carrier De Casp.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: KimTin
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I just came back from Barcelona. We had mixed feelings of our stay i this hotel. The staff members are all very nice and the check in and check out process went very smoothly. THey even uppgraded us to a Suite! We asked for some restaurant recommendations and the Tapas place just 15 minutes walk away was superb. However, on the other days they where not able to really give us any other recommendations than the restaurant located next to the hotel. The Suite was nice, clean and we had a huge patio too, but the patio should be equipped better and actually looked quite harsh. In our opinion this hotels downfall is that there is no sound isolation at all. Well we knew that there is a renovation on going in the hotel and that is somehow taken in concideration in room rates, but still the noise coming from the construction during business hours was unbearable. It was literarely like living in a major construction site. So sleeping late was impossible even with earplugs and spending timed during the afternoon in the hotel room was not really pleasant. Also in the evenings you could hear our neighbours a little too well and all sound from the corridor could be heard way too loud. It even bothered me and I would concider myself as a really heavy sleeper. I cannot see myself staying at this hotel atleast until the renovation has fully been completed.

Reviews.Title: “Really Liked This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mfreund72
Reviews.Content: Hotel has good location, nice rooms, friendly staff, very modern and updated, good price, an over-all good experience. We emailed the hotel directly and received a decent pricing for a suite. Upon arrive the staff was friendly and continued that way through our three plus days. Rooms were big, clean, and updated. The hotel is located two/three blocks from the main square and a block from the Metro. The main district is in walking distance, plenty or stores, and places to eat. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good hotel with competitive price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: travelgal76
Reviews.Content: Hotel Constanza is 5-minute walk from Urquinaona Metro Station (exit Bruc). The street is lined with fashion boutiques, so the neighborhood becomes rather quiet at night because everything is closed. Our room was clean, modern, but small. In fact, we were given the smallest double room according to the hotel floor plan which was posted by the elevator. Since our window faced the side of another building, our room was on the dark side. Having said that, the convenient location and cleanliness of the hotel makes our stay a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great, stylish, central hotel. Good for all the sights.”
Reviews.Author: sarah61
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazingly good value, modern and really close to most of the main sights of Barcelona. Whilst our room was not huge it was very stylish - with a great bathroom! The room would not have been out of place in a 4 star hotel - much nicer than you would expect given the reasonable price tag. The reception staff were very helpful and gave us restaurant suggestions for the evenings. Ther only slight criticism of this hotel was the noise between rooms: you could hear other people's conversations at times. However, this was by no means a big problem. Overall a great small hotel, in a brilliant location. Would definitely recommend it if you''re planning a short break to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish, quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Riever
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 08 for a surprise long weekend. Hotel is undergoing refurbishment so there is some building noise, but the deal we got reflected that (so I'm told). The reception area is very chic, a real boutique hotel, as are the bedrooms, bathrooms etc. Beware of the glass door into reception! My OH walked straight into it about 10 minutes after we arrived and nearly brained himself. Sounds funny? it wasn't. Lots of blood, thankfully not on their white suede sofas, but put a bit of a damper on the weekend to be honest. (Hotel staff were not particularly helpful, said there was a pharmacy nearby but didn't offer to help and I had to deal with man covered in blood, about to faint by myself) Check if breakfast is included in the price. It wasn't when we were there but this might have been because the restaurant was being refurbished. Noise between rooms is still an issue. Overall though it was a nice place to stay and very convenient for the city. Above all, no late night drunken street noise. Great city for a long weekend, loads to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, excellant staff and nice district to stay in”
Reviews.Author: robinhood_x
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel just north of the Gothic district of Barcelona. I can really recommend this hotel as a great base to explore Barcelona. Overall the staff are friendly and very helpful and the rooms lovely. Note: When we stayed they were re-developing most of the hotel which meant there was no restaurant/bar or breakfast offered, but the hotel offered an excellant rate to compensate for this. We were advised that we would not experience any noise and as we stayed over a weekend we did not expect any, however around 10am on Saturday morning some building work could be heard, however Sunday was very peaceful. LOOK & FEEL The hotel is set in a building that was built in the late 1800's, and has a very modern and stylish interior. This can come across as cold if your taste's are not for the very modern!. ENTRANCE & RECEPTION The entrance is of a quite street in the Eixample district, with large windows to the front and a large lobby area heading to the back of the building. As mentioned above the hotel has a very modern interior but is very stylish, and we were greeted by friendly and efficient staff on the front desk before being shown to our room. BAR & RESTAURANT As mentioned before, the bar and restuarant were shut for re-development during our stay, so I can not comment on the facilities. For breakfast you can use the local cafe's or the local supermarket near-by (turn right out of the hotel and go down one block before turning left) BEDROOM The bedroom was modern, clean and quite spacious. The hotel offers a variety of bedrooms, ours was the front with a small balcony (not big enough to sit on though). At the back I think there are bedrooms with a terrace. The bedroom had a double bed made of two single's (which is the norm for this hotel, ask for a double and they will make the two singles into a double for you). The bed was large and comfortable. The room had Air-Con (although the minimum temperature was 17c), a TV with all the usual spanish and a couple of english speaking channels (BBC World etc..), a minibar, desk and chair. Minibar prices were quite average for this class of hotel. Internet access was available, but I did not use this, instead as I needed to book some tickets, reception allowed me to use there computer and printer free of charge. BATHROOM The bathroom contained a bath and shower in one, although the bath was rather small, the shower was good with excellant pressure and plenty of hot water. Usual supplies of a combined shampoo and shower gel were provided and were of a good quality. The hairdryer was in the bathroom and actually worked (my wife's normal complaint! considering she has long hair) Towels were ok (my usual complaint) if a bit on the small side again! LOCATION Ideal for visiting the Gaudi designed buildings of Casa Batllo and the Sagrada Familia. The hotel is located in the Eixample district near a whole street of Tapa's bar's. Also you can walk from here to the Old town and Las Ramblas PARKING Not used so not sure if the hotel offers parking. OVERALL Friendly and helpful staff in a lovely building, with excellant access to all the site of Barcelona. If I am visiting again I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “i love hotel constanza”
Reviews.Author: pix1506
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights for our honeymoon. We were quite surprised that the hotel was very accurate to its website! Everything about the hotel was perfect. The room was clean, the location was good...very quiet but still in walking distance from La Ramblas. The staff was very helpful and friendly. There was also a great restaurant next door called Timbaler...they make the best cafe con leche! Overall, i recommend this place to anyone taking a trip to Barcelona... you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: MrKoop
Reviews.Content: A simple and stylish place. I've read some of the negative reviews and must stay I can't agree. My wife and I spent five nice days in the city just before the holidays. We walked absolutely everywhere, and it was always nice to come back to our clean and tasteful room. Yes it's not an extra-large space, but it's hardly the tiny one some describe. I admit, I never ate the breakfast there, instead we went to one of the many neighborhood cafes within a few blocks. And it was convenient to a lot of attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Felt right at home!”
Reviews.Author: MoeJoeZ
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel. Very centrally located within walking distance to everything, Plaza Catalunya, Bus Touriste, Corte Ingles, Las Ramblas etc. we stayed in one of the "apartamento matrimonial" one bedroom efficiency with kitchenette and private balcony overlooking the city. It was quaint, clean and the staff very efficient. It is a simple, homey place. Not a full service hotel. If what you're looking for is a nice one bedroom apartment, where you can sip wine and enjoy tapas from your private veranda each afternoon, a no-fuss hotel in a safe residential neighborhood, Hotel Constanza is for you. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: OldEnglishParis
Reviews.Content: There are four reasons why - if went back to Barcelona - we would stay at the Constanza. First, the location: in a quiet street within 20 minutes' walk of half the tourist attractions, on bus routes taking you everywhere else, and only 10 minutes walk from the bus station for the airport at Gerona. Secondly, the comfort: we had an apartment on the top floor with a kitchen and a terrace - flooded with light, quiet at night, and lots of room to stretch in. Thirdly, the value for money: we paid 150 euros for the room - which may sound a lot, but by Barcelona standards is very reasonable for an apartment. Most important of all, the staff were unbelievably helpful to us when we were robbed on the first day of our stay. A sneak-thief stole my wife's bag in the Citadella park. We lost all our keys, our credit cards, our passports, our driving licences, and all our cash except for the euros 23 I had in my pocket. I've never felt so vulnerable in my life: in a foreign city, with no papers to cross the border or get on a plane, and not even the money to buy a meal, on a Saturday afternoon when every consulate and bank is shut. We had to report the loss to the Spanish police; we had to cancel our four credit cards; we had to get a friend (and subsequently our bank) to send us money through Western Union; we had to get emergency passports out of the French and British consulates when they opened on the Monday; we had to re-arrange the whole of our holiday, cancelling hotel reservations left right and centre; we had to make arrangements for a locksmith to meet us after we got back to Paris, to break into our flat; we had to do all this in something approaching a state of shock - and we had to keep on doing it, as it dragged on for day after day. To give you just two examples of the kind of problems we ran into. We nearly had to go straight home, abandoning our holiday, after the first Western Union branch we went to refused to give us the 5,000 euros my bank wired to them, because the bank omitted my middle name - a name I haven't used since birth, except to get a passport. Again, we had to re-arrange the whole of our holiday after Europcar refused to let me have me the car I'd reserved, because all I could produce was an emergency driving licence from the French consulate and not a full licence. Throughout the whole of this ordeal the staff at the reception at the Constanza could not have been kinder. Nothing was too much trouble. They phoned for us, they faxed for us, they looked things up on the web, they gave us excellent advice. Giselle contacted our other hotels for us, more than once; Alberto found us a train running from a station ten minutes' walk away (Passag dei Greicia) to a tiny station deep in the countryside about 5 or 6 kilometres from our next hotel near the monastery at Poblet; and Rheda - most marvellous of all - got a friend, the owner of a second Western Union branch, to let us have the money we needed to continue our holiday. And that was only the tip of an iceberg of help. I really can't express my gratitude to them. They rescued us from disaster. We realised - too late - that thefts from tourists have become a major industry in Barcelona. They have a special police station (in Plaza del Catalunya) entirely devoted to taking statements from tourists who have been robbed - the queues can be very long at peak periods; and when we got to the British and the French consulates we found half a dozen officials dealing with entire waiting-rooms full of victims with much more frightening stories to tell than ours.
