We never saw the thief who stole our bag; they were attacked. In one case the thieves ripped an elderly Irish lady's bag from her in the hall of the airport; in another the thieves punctured the tire of a car while the driver and his wife were in a restaurant; then they followed them on the motorway, and when they stopped in the emergency lane, they came up to them and offered to 'help' - the help consisting of stealing the wife's bag from the back seat. We also heard of false police-cars pulling cars over on the motorway, only to rob them. Highway robbery is alive and well on autoroutes in Catalunya - and the police seem quite unable to do anything about it. So: I'm not sure we'll go back to Barcelona, even if (in the end) we heard Rolando Villazon and Nathlie Dessayes sing Massenet's Manon at the Liceu, and we got to see the monastery at Poblet, something I've wanted to do for thirty years. But if we do go, you'll see why we will stay at the Constanza.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, contemporary, great location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Migratory
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Constanza for 2 nights in July. It was very easy to find and we were delighted by how clean and updated the hotel was. The front desk staff was very courteous and accomodating. We had a nice balcony overlooking the street below but we did not have any issues with noise from the street. Our bathroom was entirely constructed of marble and was quite exquisite. The bedroom itself was large and comfortable. The location is also ideal, with a quick walk to the metro and main shopping streets. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family and would stay there again next time in Barcelona. An affordable, wonderful find!

Reviews.Title: “I would return to the Hotel Constanza.”
Reviews.Author: N.Davies
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Constanza mid July, which is not the cheapest time to visit Barcelona. Paid Euro170 per night, which was a room only rate. We had what they called an apartment on the top floor. The room was clean and bright with a sun terrace. The bathroom was spacious and there was a small area in the room with a fridge, kitchen cupboards, sink with worksurface and microwave. We tried breakfast on the first morning for convenience at Euro 6.00 per person, which was okay. Having then found our bearings we chose to have breakfast outside the hotel where there are plenty of options. The hotel is in the Exiample area of Barcelona, which we would personally recommend as the better area of the city. It is close to the Passage de Gracia and the Catalunya Rambla where there are plenty of shops, cafes and bars etc. Much better than the La Rambla area just south of Placa de Catalunya. You can walk to all the attractions from the hotel. The Gaudi houses and Sagrada Familia are very close. The staff at the hotel are very courteous and helpful. I would return to Hotel Constanza.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What I wanted, and expected!”
Reviews.Author: SafireDrms
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel pre-cruise. We arrived at 10:00 am, several hours before normal check in, and asked if we could store our baggage. The desk clerk was more than happy to assist us, and then said there was a small problem with our reservation. I really did think this was going to end badly, but the hotel did absolutley the right thing. The double room that we had booked had a broken air conditioning unit, so they offered us two single rooms, for the same price. This was fantastic since I was traveling with my sister, the more bathroom space the better! I can see how this would not have worked for a couple, but I was more than pleased with the solution. Once we checked in the desk clerk advised us our room would actually be ready in about an hour. We asked for directions to a local site we wanted to visit and she took the time to provide a map and very detailed instructions on how to get there. We stopped by to ask for directions several times, and we were always helped by a very polite person. I had looked at room photo's on TripAdvisor prior to booking, and the room was exactly what I had expected. The window in my room did look out on another roof, but since it was one night, and I didn't book the hotel for the view, I thought this was fine. The bathroom is great, and the bed was a bid hard, but I slept well anyway. I did not have any problems with the noise at all. Check out was smooth, and the charges were correct. The euro to US conversion is rough though! I'd definatley stay here again, but if it was for a longer period I would want a room with a view of some type.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: S2007
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at the Hotel Costanza for 4 days in June 2007 for a part of our honeymoon. We had a wonderful time in Barcelona and loved the Hotel Costanza. The hotel was close to main attractions but far enough from the hustle and bustle. The staff were friendly and helpful to answer any of the questions we had. Our room was great-top floor with the kitchen and terrace. We didn't notice any noise from our neighbours. A/c worked great, room was clean, comfy large bed, room decorated very nicely. Another great thing was the free internet connection the hotel offered. Loved this hotel and would return back! One word of caution-although the hotel is located in a quiter, "safer" area, please be careful with your belongings all the time even when walking around less busy areas...be alert at ALL times, especially women ie: I wouldn't carry a bag around. I will not go into details but take my word for it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Constanza”
Reviews.Author: Debby_7
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in Barcelona staying at the Constanza Hotel, and it was a lovely experience. Since I was by myself, I stayed in a single room which suited me excellent. The room is very nicely furnished, in a very modern way which made it very pleasant to stay in. It is in the back of the hotel, which made it very quiet. The bed is super comfortable and after wearing myself out walking all day it was a pleasure to come back to. The bathroom is beautiful and the people at the desk were extraordinary - I would like to praise both Albert who had the patience to sort out train schedules for me and Giselle whose warmth and welcoming smile made my stay at the hotel feel real good. And the hotel is just about 5 minutes from Place de Catalunya, but on a very quiet street in a safe neighborhood. I would definitely recommend Constanza to anybody going to Barcelona. Debby Jerusalem Israel

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Central Yet Quiet. Winning combination.”
Reviews.Author: anjemouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with my partner. Was intending to do a little sightseeing, catch up with friends who live in Barcelona and do a little travelling. This was my 5th trip to barcelona and wanted something central but quiet. Previously had stayed at hotels off ramblas, but found them to be noisy although well placed. Had also stayed near segrada familia (a bit less central) and west of the port (quite a walk back to bars/shops). Hotel constanza is about 3 roads north of placa de catalunya. So a bit quieter than staying right on the rambles but still very central. We had an apartment room as all the normal rooms were booked. Paid 150 Euros plus 7% tax. Booked directly with the hotel by emailing them, they have a home page. Room was very large, sub divided into a lounge bit and bedroom with a sliding door. A large terrace (nice but not with a good view) and large bathroom which had a big shower. The bed was massive. Another sliding door separated the kitchen facilites, with microwave, sink, hob, but there were so many cheapish bars/restaurants nearby we ended up eating out. I recommend the hotel, its a good base, and the staff are wonderful. The room is all that you need it to be, and most importantly you can sleep without being disturbed by poor noise insulation.

Reviews.Title: “What's the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: pontia
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before booking a hotel in Barcelona. I read so many great reviews about Hotel Constanza and its location, that I booked it right away. Honestly, I don't see what everyone was talking about. It's a small, modern boutique hotel with not the most convenient location. The rooms are VERY small, the sink in our room was SO incredibly small and impractical that we ended up washing out hands in the bidet!!! Be careful if you get an extra bed in the room. I'm only 5'4 and my feet were hanging off the bed!! <The location is very residential, no real restaurants or cool places nearby. For excellent location and good accomodations, try Hotel Gaudi. For a REALLY nice, modern hotel try Hotel Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: slrnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my first trip to Barcelona and think it is excellent for a first time traveler to Barcelona without much of an idea where to stay. It is walking distance to basically anywhere you want to go. The people who run the hotel could not have been nicer. It isn't luxury, but it is extremely clean, the fixtures are new, and it was very comfortable. We opted to spend a little more for the larger room and it was definitely worth the few extra euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mtn76
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay directly with the hotel for 3 nights. We had a suite and could not be happier. The rooms in Europe are very small so the suite was worth the extra space, especially if you have large luggage. Included was a desk and mirror which doubled as a vanity table. We followed other TA advice and ate elsewhere for breakfast. Some had complained of noises in reviews but we must have been lucky, we never had any noise problems, except for water running. Plus: Staff extremely friendly, very helpful. We wanted to go see the Monsterrat w/o paying the tour fees and giving up our whole day, the staff went out of their way to help us they found out we could take train + railway there directly and for so much cheaper ( 12.60 Euros pp RT) ride took 1 hour one way. Safe area, close by to everything but far from noise. Room was very clean. Cons: No internet unless you have laptop, but internet around the corner at a copy center ( 24 hours during weekdays) its $1 EURO for each half hour and 0.50 for the card. So 2.50 Eu for 1hour. Bed was comfortable, we had a queen but it really was 2 twins put together so you could feel the divider a little bit. Shower had half door which is normal over there. No english channel on TV, CNN international was not working. Spanish music channel was not working either, no clock or radio inside room. Hints: Bring your own converter + transformer hotel had converter but staff didn't know which one to use. Bring hotel address with you to give to taxi, we had no issues but was told by frontdesk there is another Hotel Constanza in Barcelona not related to this one so taxi have been getting guests to the wrong hotel. Grocery store nearby if its closed there's a large one on Las Ramblas (Carrefour) Buy your water and candy as gifts here. Tiny minibar ,we had large water and rearrranged the fridge to fit it in and no one gave us problems. We recommend the Tourist bus where you can get on and off, its 23 Eu pp for 2 days we thought it was well worth it. Just keep track of the last bus. It was still light out at 8pm so its easy to lose track of time. It includes a coupon book which helps. Must do: Ride the funicular de Montjuic amazing view of city/coastline use coupon in booklet. Well worth every penny. Funicular to the port from Columbus not worth it. Don't eat at El Glop down Casp st. unless nothing else is opened. It was ok but there's much better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: DaniKevMig
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern and we had a great updated room. We paid about 140 euros, but in comparison to other hotels this was a very good price. The breakfast was okay, nothing great. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The location is very good, out of the noise, but only a 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Another good find on Tripadvisor!”
Reviews.Author: nini74
Reviews.Content: The Golden Girls were set free again, this time in Barcelona! For those who don't know, The Golden Girls (all 61 years young) are my mum, and aunties Wendy and Dianne. I'm just the PA! Booking Booking the Constanza for the girls was easy. When I originally wrote, I received a reply immediately informing me that the Constanza would be undergoing a face lift and would not be available for my requested dates. I carried on looking at other hotels but it was hard to forget the Constanza as it had been my favourite from day one all those months ago in November 2006. At the beginning of 2007, out of the blue, I received an email from the Constanza with the good news that they would be able to accommodate the Girls! Yippee! From then on it was just a case of getting the right room. We had read, on TA, about an apartment style room with a kitchenette but we were not sure if it would be big enough for 3 adults. I received helpful emails from Mariana, Samuel and Alberto. Mam even made a phonecall to Samuel to pass on her card details (I don't like emailing credit card details) and to enquire about the kitchenette room 605. I emailed again just before their departure date to let the hotel know their ETA at the hotel only to be reassured by the hotel that they were waiting for the Girls and that I need not worry. Taxi I had asked the hotel about booking a taxi to pick them up from the airport (as we had done in Roma), but they kindly informed me that it would be quicker and cheaper just to get an airport taxi. They did this and it seemed to be the best option. A 20 minute ride costing 20 euros (they left 25 euros to include a tip) found them outside the hotel with ease! Staff They wheeled into reception and were given a warm welcome. They took the lift to their room. They struggled with the safe at first but then a phonecall down to reception sent help on the way. Mum said that there was usually just one person in reception so any calls away from the desk resulted in the front door being locked, for safety I suppose. So don't panic if you get there and the main front door is locked. Someone will be with you soon! All the staff were computer literate. Maps were quickly printed out as well as restaurant reviews and directions. Mum forgot to ask the name of the 'breakfast lady', she was very helpful and would make tea if requested, however, the coffee was good with a very adequate continental breakfast. Breakfast Coffee, hot milk, tea, fresh orange juice, tropical juice, hot chocolate. If in doubt, ask! Cereals, fresh fruit, cheeses, meats, tomatoes, fresh bread and cut bread for toast, chocolate cake, croissants and chocolate croissants, egg frittata. Room The room was big enough for three adults. They had a roof top balcony with table and 2 chairs and a stool, no bird poo! There was no street noise at the back of the hotel. The black out blinds are a brilliant and very thoughtful idea. The beds were comfy and wide. The third bed was just as comfy but a bit lower. They just heard the people next door going out in the morning, no ear-plugs needed. Rooms cleaned everyday, and given fresh towels daily too. Very good decor throughout Kitchenette was clean and handy. There was no kettle (use a pan) but a stove top neapolitan coffee maker. A fridge (also with minibar), 2 hot plates and a microwave! 2 of everything else, glasses, cups etc Location Excellent. Easy walking to Placa Catalunya, the hub of all things. They even made their own way to Monserrat for 19 euro! Value for money 180 euro for the room per night + I booked a 6 euro breakfast for 3 adults 5 mornings + 7% tax = great value! Eating Just ask the staff for suggestions. Plenty of tapas bars around and nice Thai rest at the top of the block. They liked Origens 99.9 the best. The one beside the gorgeous Basilica de Santa Maria del Mar. Well, I think I've overheated the keyboard! The Girls would love to go back to the Constanza. Great find, thanks TA and TA members, and of course, the Constanza and your excellent staff! nini (Mam's PA!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tulsau
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. The hotel has a very good location and a great staff. We stayed in a suite for 140Euro/night. The price was a little high but most of Barcelona is expensive. The rooms were tastefully decorated and very clean. I do agree that the walls are very thin. You can hear everything going on in the room next door. But it still wasn't that bad. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Were Looking For in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: slctravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Constanza one night before a Seabourn cruise. We took Eurobus to Pl. Catalunya and walked about six minutes to hotel at 8 a.m. Staff was very friendly, confirmed our reservation, and provided a place to store luggage until check in at 2. The double room was clean and of average European size. We were not bothered by noise some have mentioned. The location is really unbeatable - a pleasant walk to all the places we wanted to see. We ate breakfast at little cafes near by and the hotel recommended a great restaurant for dinner. A taxi to the pier was 12 euro. This hotel is a great value in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for central location”
Reviews.Author: nmp14
Reviews.Content: Clean with nice decor and reasonably large rooms. Excellent location about 10- minutes walk from Barri Gothic and 15minutes from the SAngria Familia. The hotel is great as a base base to visit the sites or even if you are there on business ( free internet connection) . However there are few facilities outside the room and the food (breakfast only) is very limitted in range and quality- for 6 euros you would be much better visitting on of the many local cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: skarry76
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but this hotel is a great value for the price --hip, modern design and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: EternalNomad
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler I've used the Trip Advisor website a lot and have found the reviews to be pretty accurate. Therefore, I felt compelled to post my review of the Hotel Constanza after my three day visit, which ended on April 2nd, 2007. The pluses: The hotel is in a good, convenient, quiet location. It's two blocks up from the Urquinoana metro stop and not too far from the passeig de Gracia metro stop. In about ten minutes, you could walk to the Plaza de Catalunya and begin your stroll down Las Ramblas (although I recommend the El Born district for cool restaurants, good atmosphere, and beautiful women). I was travelling solo but opted to stay in a suite, which is basically a normal hotel room in the US. Comfortable beds, internet access (not wireless, you need a cable), very clean and modern rooms, cold, marble floors. Even if you stay on the street the external noise factor is minimal, as this area of the lower Eixample is pretty quiet. Nice botique restaurants are all around should you not want to travel far for a meal or glass of wine. The breakfast (6 Euros) is basic: yogurt, cereal, pastries, coffee, OJ (no eggs or hot foods). Service is very cordial and helpful. The vibe here is couples, 30's & 40's, doing their thing, coming back for a good night sleep. The minuses: Not many, but there's one major: Bring ear plugs to sleep (or keep them from your flight). The modern hotel theme, with marble/concrete floors means every room is a theatre for the entire floor. I can hear every word of my neighbors soft-spoken conversation, every door closed, toilet flushed, etc. and I knew they could hear me. My neighbors were pretty quiet, but I could imagine if Mr. and Mrs. Loud Talker checked in. I doubt you'll have to worry about the late night return of the party crew at this hotel, but that would be worse. There are probably better places to stay (like on Rambla de Catalunya above Via de les Corts), but I have to give this hotel its props. Take it for what its worth, the advice from a mid-thirties bachelor (on a half business, half vacation trip) who likes the adventure and late nights, but needs a little more rest and recovery time than I did 10 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water/Heating for 36 hours!”
Reviews.Author: NatalieF
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend staying in the Hotel Constanza - and what a nightmare it was! Checking in was painful, took 30 mins and 3 reception staff! We had booked an apartment on the 6th floor. Was firstly given room 602, but this has a huge wall, blocking any view that you get from the terrace, so we asked to move to another room and was given 601. On the face of it, the room was bright, clean and modern. The bed is tiny - not even a standard double (4'6" in uk terms) and the bathroom no tub - which is vital after a hours pounding the streets of Bacelona.! But these were the least of our worries! We then found out, that evening that the hot water and heating system had broken down! After travelling from London at 4am, this wasn't ideal! It then took then 36 hours to get the systems working again! We had 4 blankets on the bed that evening to sleep, as the room was so cold!! As the hotel was fully booked, they couldn't offer us another room. So I had to result to boiling water on the hob in the mini kitchen and pouring this in the sink! Not ideal when your paying €150 a night! As I result of this, they offered us 20% off the room rate - which was embarassing and a free breakfast which was terrible anyway! The rooms are not well soundproofed, you can hear people walking around the corriders, and also the other rooms using there showers/toilets etc... None of the English TV channels work, which isn't a huge issue, but if you like to catch on the news etc, your out of luck! The area surrounding the hotel is safe, and about 10 mins walk from Plaza Catalunya, and Passig de Gracia. There isn't much around the hotel but the Thai restaurant at the end of the road is amazing! Best Thai food I have eaten! All in all, this hotel struggled to live up to the other reviews that I had read and I was very disappointed! I would rather spend the extra €20 and stay at the Hotel 1898 in a standard room!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TamLeamingtonSpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Constanza during our second visit to Barcelona, we had previously stayed quite a long way from the centre so location was very important when chosing our hotel. We couldn't have asked for more, close enough to all the main attractions but not so close that it was in a noisy area. The hotel is nicely finished and we found the staff to be both friendly and efficient, they obliged us when we wanted to split the bill and let us leave our bags as we had a late flight, there by allowing us to explore the city for another day. We didn't have breakfast included in our booking but it was very reasonable and there didn't seem much point going elsewhere, the lady even remembered my tea preferences. Our room was at the front of the hotel and directly above the front doors of the hotel, there was a certain amount of noise associated with that but not too bad. It could be quite noisy from the street in the morning but nothing so bad that I was woken up and the bed was very comfy. You could hear people in the adjacent rooms which I think is not helped because of the floor materials used, no carpet to absorb the noise. But for the price and location I thought this hotel had a nice balance and in any big city it's going to be difficult to eliminate all the noise. A great base to explore this amazing city, we did so much walking and exploring we were always pleased to see the smiling receptionist when we got back to the hotel knowing we would be able to rest ready for the next days exploring. I would definitely stay at the Constanza again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Justino
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from staying one night at this hotel I felt the need to give an honest opinion about it. Given the fabulous reviews most people have given I felt quite confident about booking this place. It was easy enough to find(although none of the locals had heard of it) and first impressions were good - trendy smart reception area, smooth background music, comfy leather furniture etc. Our room was a studio apartment on the 6th floor with a large roof terrace(the main reason for booking).The immediate impression of the room was quite good - modern,light but a somewhat cold feeling.We had asked for a double bed - it looked tiny and felt like a large single( no good if you happen to be 6 feet tall and used to king size! During the day the room seemed OK and not too noisy, but at night the traffic droned on and on and on and on!!! Also our tiny bed was next to some crucial plumbing and I was woken everytime anyone in the hotel used their bathroom.I found it impossible to sleep because of the noise and spent the night tossing and turning in the tiny bed with a cheap mattress.I was consequently too tired to appreciate Barcelona the next day and resented parting with 140 euros when for £15 I had a great sleep at the Stansted airport`s new Travellodge! The staff were also incompetent and frosty (it took over 30 minutes to check out because the receptionist was obviously computer illiterate. In short this place is mutton dressed as lamb and I wouldn`t even rate it as a 1 star hotel.What a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: BrendanWakefield
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Constanza for a weekend over the 23rd Feb. It is very clean and well looked after, the staff are very friendly but we did not bump into them too much as we were out and about in the city. The room was very nice with a large bathroom, comfy bed and loads of room. This hotel is ideally situated to walk to all the main places of interest, it is also only 5 mins walk to Placa Catalunya where you can hop on and off the Tourist Bus. I would highly recommend the tourist bus as a way to get to see all the sites that are not within walking distance. Park Guell and Segrada Famillia are a must. Suberb Thai restaurant only 30 seconds walk away and the Casa Calvet is 30 seconds the other way. A couple of bars nearly by but not too much going on there, there is a square on the way to the Place Catalunya where there are a few decend bars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Middle of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Gole_G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at the Constanza in early December 2006, as part of our honeymoon trip to Spain and Portugal. The hotel is conveniently located around four blocks north-east of Plaza Catalunya. The closest metro stop is two blocks south at Plaza Urquinaona. The hotel has a warm feeling and the rooms are comfortable. I wrote about a week before our trip to get a double bed instead of two single beds and they complied. Our room had a small balcony facing the street, which was a nice detail. The staff was always friendly and responded to our requests. The toiletries provided by the hotel were rather basic, so I would recommend bringing your own. We paid around 115 USD per night, including taxes, which I consider a good price for what we received. Overall, the Constanza is a good hotel choice in Barcelona. I would stay there again without a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: turkey
Reviews.Content: Like many of you I found this hotel on Tripadvisor and have no complaints at all. The paperwork stated check in was from 2pm, we arrived in Barcelona at about 10am and went directly to the hotel to leave our cases and go for an explore before the room was ready. Upon arrival at Constanza the friendly receptionist said our room was ready and we had been upgraded to a suite. The room itself was immaculate with patio doors leading onto a terrace with table and chairs. (I have stayed in other Barcelona hotels, all of which have been dearer than the Constanza, but none of which met the same standards) The reception staff were always willing to help whether it be with suggestions on where to eat, and they were also more than happy to keep our cases in a safe room when we checked out of the room as our flight was not until the evening. Breakfast was as you would expect in any European hotel of this standard. ie coffee, juice, croissants, cheese, meats etc. Not 5* but quite sufficient. Even if you spent a great deal more on your hotel you would be hard pushed to beat Hotel Constanza. Only 5-10 mins walk to Ramblas and Barri Gothic so the location could not be faulted, and as others have stated at least you could get a good nights sleep which would not be the case if you stayed in a hotel on the Ramblas. Value for money alone it has to be given a 5 out of 5. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: glynnhesel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night saty at the Constanza and found it to be very good value. The location is excellent being close to the centre but not in the very busy Rambas zone. The staff were very firendly and helpful. We would return here without hesitation. One travel tip re the Barcelona Card. Think about whether you will be able to get full value from the card as although the discounts on entrance fees are reasonably generous the fees themselves tend not to be very high. We paid 48 euros for 2 x two day cards and we would have been better off simply paying as we went along. Might be worth it if you are planning to make extensive use of the transport systems. We did not.

Reviews.Title: “Book a Suite.”
Reviews.Author: Boet
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good, but the standard double rooms are very noisy. Bus stop just in front of hotel. I upgraded to a suite (the suites are located in the back of the hotel) after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rob1959
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from an excellent stay at the constanza.The hotel is modern and contemporary, the rooms large enough and comfortably furnished and the staff were friendly and efficient. The hotel, suprisingly, was quiet on our arrival and we were lucky enough to receive an upgrade to a suite....nice touch. Prices were very reasonable by booking through the venere website. On top of all this location is excellent, walking distance from the bus station ( where those travelling on the ryanair bus from gerona will arrive). centrally placed for walking into the bars and restaurants of the Born/barri gothic areas and equidistant in the opposite direction to the architecture of Eixample. All in all an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Five star budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: nysingle
Reviews.Content: If there is such a thing as a five-star budget hotel, the Hotel Constanza is it. Stayed there this week (Jan. 07) for 60 euro a night. That is less than many Motel 6 locations, for the folks in the U.S., and this hotel is in the middle of Barcelona, not the boonies. The room was nice, spacious, and beautifully furnished, as nice as or nicer than some Hiltons / Westins / etc. The staff was attentive and very helpful. The location, for me, was perfect. There are several Metro stops nearby, including Catalunya, Passeig de Gracia, and Girona, all of which are within a 5-10 minute walk. It's easy to get to with luggage from the airport or Barcelona-Sants (train sta.). It is within walking distance to ALL the sights except for Parc Guell. Catalunya / Ramblas is about 10 minutes away, Passeig de Gracia (Discordia, Pedrera) is about 10-15 minutes away, and Arc de Triomf, Ciutadella, Barri Gothi, and the Montjuc funicular are a little bit farther, but still walkable. There are many good places to eat nearby (though somewhat touristy) and several supermarkets, groceries, bakeries, and fast food joints. I liked Tapa Tapa and Fraggi (delicious, pricy ice cream) on P. de Gracia, and there are two all-you-can-eat joints nearby (FresCo and Lactuca) if you're into that sort of thing. For what it's worth, food is relatively cheap in Spain, and the difference between all-you-can-eat and a regular joint isn't that much, with a step up in food quality / selection; but if you're really really hungry, it may be worth it. There is an Internet place two blocks away if you don't bring your laptop with you. All in all, two big thumbs up, and without a doubt, would stay there again. Given the value, this hotel should be listed #1.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: turistola
Reviews.Content: Very nice small boutique hotel in the centre of Barcelona. Perfect location for almost everything. Nearest tube station a 2 min walk , 5 min to Catalunya. Friendly and very helpful staff. I had a single room, nice furnished with a lovely stylish bathroom. Free internet access are available (cable) Will stay here again.-higly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: pattra
Reviews.Content: Just come back from our 7 nights stay at the Constanza and we agree with all the positive reviews; the hotel looks exactly like the pictures on its website, the staff are extremely helpful and nice, the room cleand and comfortable and the location is unbeatable, in a safe area and very central. There are just a few inconveniences. You DO need to bring your own toiletries as the one provided by the hotel is quite substandard, there's no room slipper and you actually hear fragments of your neighbors conversation but this is easily solved with a pair of earplugs. All in all, this is a great little hotel which delivers everything as it promises. A real value for money and difinitely more than a two stars hotel. p.s we had a meal at Casa Calvet, the restaurant housed in one of Gaudi's building on Casp street and had to say that it wasn't worth it as the food was just ok but the price steep. Our best meals were tapas at Cerveria Catalana on 236 Mallorca street and of course, the famed Cal Pep (you really, really have to be there like 15 mins before it opens). The Thai Sabai Sabai restaurant which locates just around the corner from the hotel on Gran Via de Catalanes street is excellent and serves Thai food that tastes lke we eat in Thailand, trust us, we are Thai.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet!!”
Reviews.Author: Export_Sales_Manager
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel, if you need a simple, clean, freindly hotel. Being near to a Metro station makes it useful too. I asked for a quiet room and got one looking inside which was peacefully quiet. A rare thing in Barcelona. Smallish room and bathroom, very basic breakfast for 6 € . So if you are American and want lots of space and lots of ameneties, maybe not your choice. But for me on business it was perfectly adequate ( including internet connection and a good working air conditioning ) - and as said, there are dozens of higher-priced hotels in Barcelona where you cannot sleep for the traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “A Steal!”
Reviews.Author: a9zn
Reviews.Content: Great location. Short walk to everything. Hotel room is small but modern, has both TV & fridge. However, most of the reviews were written by couples. I, as a single traveler, had a slightly different experience. My room, 104, faces the elevator, despite my request for a quiet room away from the elevator & noise, can hear everyone's footsteps coming in & out of the hotel, especially at 2 am in the morning. If you're single, request room 111, which is on the other side of the floor, hence less foot traffic. Couples should request any of the 4 double rooms that come with a terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: dipdop
Reviews.Content: Booked direct with hotel as all websites (Hotels.com, expedia, lastminute etc) all said there were no rooms left. We were told there was a problem with the room on arrival so they put us in a suite instead. Room was great , very tasteful, clean and modern decor. Nice bathroom with good shower. Nice patio area too - but these are only with the suites i think. Staff helpful when we had a problem with the roomsafe. 10 min walk to Catalunya square and small supermarket 2 blocks away in same direction. 20 min walk to Bari Gotic, Born at night for nightlife. 15 min walk to bus sation to catch coach to girona airport (Ryanair). Cold breakfast buffet for 6 euros was ok - usual meat, cheese, breads, juice, coffee etc. Would recommend Bus Turistic for getting bearings and seeing all the city and not just Ramblas. Would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Handy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wombat36
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in this small Boutique Hotel in August. Room excellent. Had balcony/patio. Close to all tourist needs including La Ramblas, Gaudi Houses, eating places abound. Staff very helpful. An ideal hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; great value”
Reviews.Author: StevenAllen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Constanza for five nights in mid-July. The Constanza has an ideal location, near the intersection of Passeig de Gracia and Gran Via. This puts you within walking distance of the Barri Gotic, Born, and Eixample. We are big walkers, so we also trekked to the Sagrada Famila and the beach. The room was very nicely appointed and spacious; we had a sixth floor efficiency with an outside terrace. We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet at a reasonable 6 euros a head. This is not a full-service hotel with a restaurant, room service, concierge and name-brand toiletries. But it more than met our needs at a very reasonable price. A special bonus is that it is just around the corner from Casa Calvet, a very special restaurant in one of Gaudi's creations!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel at Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: Motienko
Reviews.Content: Have just spent the last weekend of July in this great hotel and can't praise it enough: the location is perfect without being overcrowded and noisy (just 5 minutes walk from Pg Gracia with its fancy boutiques and Gaudi's masterpiece, La Pedrera, and 15 minutes walk from the Ramblas); the room and the bathroom are spacious, beautiful and comfortable; the decor is fashionable but not cold; the hospitality is of highest standard (Claire and Alberto couldn't have been more welcoming and helpful). Not mentioning all those little bonuses - the private terrace, the WiFi in the room which works like a clock , the air-conditioning which was so good that it made me forget about the horrible heat outside, the cool zen touches here and there, the decent breakfast ... all that at a very reasonable price. I have stayed in a number of hotels in Barcelona before, many of them were truly good, but I have no doubt about where to go during my next trip. Highly recommended!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Constanza Barcelona
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Bruc 33, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
